api_reference.title: billpay_expired
api_reference.description: A billpay or refund check did not clear six months after the check's date, so the check has been voided. The payment has not yet been returned to the account, so the available balance has not changed. When the amount is returned to the account, a BADJ: adj event message is sent. Code â€” BPEX Event trigger â€” A check is not returned or cashed for six months. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: Internal process that monitors check expiry Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description billpay_id X Unique identifier for this billpay or refund-check transaction. Example: "2436543" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" check_no X Number of the expired check. Example: "2345" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "BPEX" original_balance_id Refund checks only. Balance ID (galileo_account_number) of the closed account that is being refunded. Example: "543922" original_prn Refund checks only. PRN (pmt_ref_no) of the closed account that is being refunded. Example: "999101344532" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "billpay_expired" xid X Internal Galileo-generated ID for an account. Example: "13162" Example JSON# billpay_expired example: { "billpay_id": "2436543", "check_no": "2345", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "BPEX", "original_balance_id": "543922", "original_prn": "999101344532", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "billpay_expired", "xid": "13162" }

Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "BPCR" open_to_buy X The available balance to spend. Example: "500.00" original_balance_id Refund checks only. Balance ID (galileo_account_number) of the closed account that is being refunded. Example: "543922" original_prn Refund checks only. PRN (pmt_ref_no) of the closed account that is being refunded. api_reference.title: billpay_retry
api_reference.description: The billpay process must retry a transaction that was sent to the External Trans API. Either a timeout occurred, or you indicated that Galileo should try again later. Code â€” BPAR Event trigger â€” The billpay webhook process failed and a retry will occur, or you responded with code 99 (error, retry). Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: Billpay webhook sent Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description act_type For all bill payments and refund checks the activity type is "AD". amount X Amount of the payment. Example: "376.50" balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" billername X Name of the biller. billpay_id X Unique identifier for this billpay or refund-check transaction. Example: "2436543" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" credit_balance For credit accounts, the total amount of unpaid purchases and advances. Example: "325.00" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "BPAR" open_to_buy X The available balance to spend. Example: "500.00" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "billpay_retry" Example JSON# billpay_retry example: { "act_type": "AD", "amount": "376.50", "balance_id": "20211", "billpay_id": "2436543", "credit_balance": "325.00", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "BPAR", "open_to_buy": "500.00", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "billpay_retry" }

api_reference.title: billpay_switch_event
api_reference.description: The status of a payment method switch has changed. Code â€” BPSE Event trigger â€” The status of a payment method switch changes. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: Account holder initiates a payment method switch. Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description account_type Whether the payment account is a checking or savings. Example: "Checking" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" company X The service provider or merchant system for bill payment. Example: "ABC Company" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" lastfour X Last four digits of the account number or card number. Example: "1234" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "BPSE" payment_type X Whether the payment method is a bank or card. Example: "card" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" routing_number The routing number for the payment account. Example: "123456789" status X The new status of the payment method switch: processing, completed, failed Example: "completed" status_reason The reason for the new status when status: failed. See Payment Method Switch Failure Status Reasons for valid values. task X Transaction ID for a sign-up attempt. Example: "602414d84f9a1980cf5eafcc" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" title The title or description of the payment method. Example: "Premiere Checking" type X The name of this event: "billpay_switch_event" Example JSON# billpay_switch_event example: { "account_type": "Checking", "company": "ABC Company", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "lastfour": "1234", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "BPSE", "payment_type": "card", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "routing_number": "123456789", "status": "completed", "status_reason": "payment-method-not-supported", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "title": "Premiere Checking", "type": "billpay_switch_event" }

api_reference.title: bulk_frozen
api_reference.description: A card was frozen by a bulk-freeze action in the Customer Service Tool. The account and card statuses were not changedâ€”only the status value in the freeze_info object was changed. Code â€” CDFR Event trigger â€” The status value in the freeze_info object is changed to frozen. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: Customer Service Tool Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description avail_cash For debit accounts, the open_to_buy plus available overdraft. Example: "143.11" avail_credit For credit accounts, the available credit limit to spend. Example: "432.00" balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" cad X Galileo-generated card ID. Example: "12534" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" credit_balance For credit accounts, the total amount of unpaid purchases and advances. Example: "325.00" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "CDFR" new_status X Card status code. See Card Statuses for possible values. Because freezing a card does not change its status, this status is the same as before the freeze. Example: "N" open_to_buy X The available balance to spend. Example: "500.00" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "bulk_frozen" Example JSON# bulk_frozen example: { "avail_cash": "143.11", "avail_credit": "432.00", "balance_id": "20211", "cad": "12534", "credit_balance": "325.00", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "CDFR", "new_status": "N", "open_to_buy": "500.00", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "bulk_frozen" }

api_reference.title: card_shipped

This event is triggered for both new cards and reissued cards. Code â€” SHIP Event trigger â€” An emboss record is created for the card. Processes â€” These processes contain the event trigger: An internal process that collects embossing data for all cards with status: X. An internal process that collects embossing data for Digital First cards. Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. Example: "454 Pine St." addr2 Address line 2 where the card will be shipped. Example: "Apt 2D" avail_cash For debit accounts, the open_to_buy plus available overdraft. Example: "143.11" avail_credit For credit accounts, the available credit limit to spend. Example: "432.00" balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" cad X Galileo-generated card ID. Example: "12534" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" city City where the card will be shipped. Example: "Salt Lake City" credit_balance For credit accounts, the total amount of unpaid purchases and advances. Example: "325.00" emboss_expiry_date Expiration date on the emboss record. Example: "2025-04-12" emboss_uuid UUID for an emboss record that has been sent to the embosser. Example: "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000" fname Cardholder's first name. Example: "Mirela" is_emboss_reissue Whether this is a reissued card. Example: "Y" lname Cardholder's last name. Example: "Arroyo" msg_event_id X Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "SHIP" open_to_buy X The available balance to spend. Example: "500.00" opentobuy_ts The exact date-time at which open_to_buy was captured. Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.ssssss Example: "2025-03-17 14:06:50.243654" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" protected_pan_four The last four digits of the PAN. Example: "MN" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Example: "84101" Example JSON# cardholder_info_changed example: { "addr1": "564 Elm St.", "addr2": "Apt 41", "balance_id": "20211", "city": "Eden Prairie", "country": "840", "dob": "03/16/1981", "email": "user@domain.com", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "fname": "Mirela", "home_phone": "8015553234", "lname": "Arroyo", "mname": "W", "mobile_phone": "8015553768", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "CHPC", "other_phone": "8015553222", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "state": "MN", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "cardholder_info_changed", "zip": "84101" }

api_reference.title: case_created
api_reference.description: A dispute case has been created by either the Dispute API or the CST. Code â€” CSCT Event trigger â€” One of these things occurs: The Submit Case endpoint is successfully called at the end of the dispute intake flow. A case is submitted in the CST. Processes â€” These processes contain the event trigger: Intake flow for the Dispute API Dispute tracker in the CST Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description case_no X Identifier for the case. Example: "22021000017C" case_notice_date X Date when the cardholder initiated the dispute. Format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss. This value is sometimes empty. Example: "2025-04-23 14:24:05" case_rege_date X Due date for a Regulation E dispute. Format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2025-05-13 13:04:05" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" dispute_count X Number of disputed transactions included in the case. Example: "5" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "CSCT" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "case_created" Example JSON# case_created example: { "case_no": "22021000017C", "case_notice_date": "2025-04-23 14:24:05", "case_rege_date": "2025-05-13 13:04:05", "dispute_count": "5", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "CSCT", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "case_created" }

This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. api_reference.title: create_hold
api_reference.description: A hold has been placed on all or part of the specified account. The available balance has changed. This event is triggered by holds that you create, ACH transactions, and automated processes, but not by holds created by card-network authorizations. Code â€” CRHD Event trigger â€” A hold is placed on the account. Processes â€” These processes contain the event trigger: Create Hold endpoint ACH transaction Customer Service Tool Automated processes Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description avail_cash For debit accounts, the open_to_buy plus available overdraft. Example: "143.11" avail_credit For credit accounts, the available credit limit to spend. Example: "432.00" balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" credit_balance For credit accounts, the total amount of unpaid purchases and advances. Example: "325.00" currency Currency code for hold_amount. Example: "840" description Description for the hold. Example: "Manual hold" expiry_dt Date-time when the hold will expire. Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2025-12-02 14:10:17" hold_amount Amount of the hold. Example: "25.00" hold_id X Unique identifier for the hold. Example: "234567" hold_source The table that hold_source_id comes from. Example: "pmt_info" hold_type The transaction type (otype) of the hold. See the curated list of hold types for your program. Example: "OR" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "CRHD" open_to_buy X The available balance to spend. Example: "500.00" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "create_hold" Example JSON# create_hold example: { "avail_cash": "143.11", "avail_credit": "432.00", "balance_id": "20211", "credit_balance": "325.00", "currency": "840", "description": "Manual hold", "expiry_dt": "2025-12-02 14:10:17", "hold_amount": "25.00", "hold_id": "234567", "hold_source": "pmt_info", "hold_type": "OR", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "CRHD", "open_to_buy": "500.00", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "create_hold" }

api_reference.title: credit_limit_change
api_reference.description: The limit on a credit account changed. Code â€” CLIM Event trigger â€” The credit limit changes. Processes â€” These processes contain the event trigger: Set Credit Limit endpoint Automated processes Customer Service Tool Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description amount X The change_type indicates what this value represents. Example: "500.25" balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" change_ts X Time at which the credit limit was changed. YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2025-03-24 13:43:02" change_type X Type of change: S â€” Limit was set to amount I â€” Limit was increased by amount D â€” Limit was decreased by amount cred_lim_hist_id X Identifier for this credit limit change. extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "CLIM" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" reason_code X Reason for changing the limit: 0 â€” Manual update, data fix 1 â€” Direct deposit threshold met 2 â€” Direct deposit threshold failed 3 â€” Secured balance updated 4 â€” Overdraft limit changed type X The name of this event: "credit_limit_change" user_name X The user who made the change. Example JSON# credit_limit_change example: { "amount": "500.25", "balance_id": "20211", "change_ts": "2025-03-24 13:43:02", "change_type": "S", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "CLIM", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "reason_code": "0", "type": "credit_limit_change" }

api_reference.title: denied_auth
api_reference.description: An authorization request was denied. Available balance has not changed. This event is sent only when the reason for the denial is not covered by one of these other authorization-denial events: PUMP: denied_auth_gas NACT: denied_auth_inactive_card IPIN: denied_auth_invalid_pin BNSF: denied_auth_nsf BPAN: denied_auth_bad_pan Code â€” DAUT Event trigger â€” You or Galileo deny an authorization request. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: Galileo receives one of these messages from a card network: Preauthorization request Authorization request Fields The data elements (DEs) in the field descriptions may vary by network. All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description amount X The amount of the authorization request. Includes fees and upcharges. DE004 times the conversion rate in DE009. The amount is signed: - to debit the account and + to credit the account. Example: "10.25" auth_id X Galileo-generated ID for the authorization request. This ID is unique per subnetwork. Example: "12303090" auth_id_response Authorization identification response, a numeric code that Galileo returns to a merchant to verify that the transaction was authorized. DE038. Example: "012547" auth_tran_type Based on DE003, processing code. Type of authorization request. See Authorization types for possible values. Example: "5" avail_cash For debit accounts, the open_to_buy plus available overdraft. Example: "143.11" avail_credit For credit accounts, the available credit limit to spend. Example: "432.00" balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" cad X Galileo-generated card ID. Example: "12534" cashback_amount Amount of the transaction that is cashback instead of purchase. This amount is included in amount. Example: "20.00" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" client_id ID for the customer record. Example: "264539" credit_balance For credit accounts, the total amount of unpaid purchases and advances. Example: "325.00" credit_ind Whether a PIN was input at the point of sale: Y (no PIN was input) or N (a PIN was input) or None (not a card transaction, or not processed as a card transaction). Example: "Y" currency Currency code for amount, which is the currency of the cardholder account. Example: "840" de003 Raw contents of DE003, processing code. See DE003 Codes for possible values. Example: "002000" de022 Raw contents of DE022, POS entry mode. See DE022 Codes for possible values. Example: "071" domestic Whether this is a domestic transaction. Y is domestic; N is international. Example: "Y" fee_amt Program transaction fee. Example: "2.00" financial_network_code The financial bank card product or branding of the card. DE063SE1. Valid values: CI (Cirrus), MC (Mastercard credit), MD (Debit Mastercard), MS (Maestro), PL (Visa Plus), PV (Private Label), VI (Visa) Example: "MS" fund_pmt_ref_no The PRN of the RTF or Corporate Credit funding account that is associated with this spending account. Example: "122101354223" latest_incremental_id The auth_id of the previous authorization in an incremental sequence. May contain the same value as original_auth_id. Example: "12303085" local_currency Currency code for local_currency_amount (DE049). Example: "124" local_currency_amount Amount of the transaction in the currency at the point of sale (DE004). No fees or upcharges included. Example: "1245.20" local_surcharge_amt The surcharge amount (DE028) added by the merchant or ATM operator. This amount is included in amount. Example: "2.50" mc_installment_pmt_data Contents of DE112 SE7. See MSI Installments data to interpret the code. Example: "030600484" mc_promotion_code Contents of DE048 SE95. See MSI Installments data to interpret the code. Example: "MEXCTA" mcc X Merchant category code (DE018). Example: "5712" merchant Concatenation of merchant_name and merchant_location. Example: "RIDESHARE.COM/CHARGES, SAN FRANCISCO, CA" merchant_location X Merchant city and state (from remaining part of ISO DE043). Example: "NEW YORK, NY" merchant_name X Merchant name (first 22 characters of DE043). Should not be used for matching; instead, use merchant_number. Example: "Widgets Incorporated" merchant_number X Merchant number (DE042). Example: "L4DIV6D5LM4X7LF" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "DAUT" network X See Events Network Codes for possible values. Example: "V" open_to_buy X The available balance to spend. Example: "500.00" opentobuy_ts The exact date-time at which open_to_buy was captured. Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.ssssss Example: "2025-03-17 14:06:50.243654" original_auth_id The auth_id of the previous authorization in a sequence. For a completion, this is the auth_id of the preauthorization. For a reversal, this is the auth_id of the transaction that is being reversed. For an incremental sequence, this is the auth_id of the previous authorization in the sequence. Example: "12303085" original_incremental_id The auth_id of the first authorization in an incremental sequence. Example: "12302001" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" response_code X See Authorization Response Codes for possible values. Example: "05" response_reasons Pipe-delimited list of factors that were calculated for response_code. Example: "Acquiring merchant blocked by product|Suspected fraud" risk_score Risk score provided by the network. Higher numbers mean higher risk. Example: "26" rules_results X Comma-delimited list of DENY, WARN or FREEZE rules from Galileo's dynamic fraud engine. Example: "hr_crypto:DENY, intl_cnp_ecom:DENY" settle_currency Currency code for settle_currency_amount. Example: "840" settle_currency_amount Amount of the settlement in the settlement currency. Example: "35.44" sign_amount Contains - (minus sign) when the amount debits the open_to_buy. Example: "-" stan System trace audit number, a unique identifier assigned to each transaction by the originator of the message. DE011. Example: "000803" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" tlid Mastercard only. Transaction link identifier. An identifier that Mastercard generates for every original transaction. DE105SF1. Example: "f3a54c321e634e9b" token_requester Name of the entity that is requesting a tokenized version of the card. Example: "Apple Inc." token_requester_id Identifier for "token_requester". Example: "40010030273" token_type Name of token requester. Example: "Apple Inc." type X The name of this event: "denied_auth" user_data Populated according to your use case and needs by arrangement with Galileo. visa_trans_id Contents of Field 62.2: Transaction Identifier (bitmap format). This Visa-generated transaction ID is unique for each original authorization and financial request. Example: "141037867734271" Example JSON# denied_auth example: { "amount": "10.25", "auth_id": "12303090", "auth_id_response": "012547", "auth_tran_type": "5", "avail_cash": "143.11", "avail_credit": "432.00", "balance_id": "20211", "cad": "12534", "cashback_amount": "20.00", "client_id": "264539", "credit_balance": "325.00", "credit_ind": "Y", "currency": "840", "de003": "002000", "de022": "071", "domestic": "Y", "fee_amt": "2.00", "financial_network_code": "MS", "latest_incremental_id": "12303085", "local_currency": "124", "local_currency_amount": "1245.20", "local_surcharge_amt": "2.50", "mc_installment_pmt_data": "030600484", "mc_promotion_code": "MEXCTA", "mcc": "5712", "merchant": "RIDESHARE.COM/CHARGES, SAN FRANCISCO, CA", "merchant_location": "NEW YORK, NY", "merchant_name": "Widgets Incorporated", "merchant_number": "L4DIV6D5LM4X7LF", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "DAUT", "network": "V", "open_to_buy": "500.00", "opentobuy_ts": "2025-03-17 14:06:50.243654", "original_auth_id": "12303085", "original_incremental_id": "12302001", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "response_code": "05", "response_reasons": "Acquiring merchant blocked by product|Suspected fraud", "risk_score": "26", "rules_results": "hr_crypto:DENY, intl_cnp_ecom:DENY", "settle_currency": "840", "settle_currency_amount": "35.44", "stan": "000803", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "tlid": "f3a54c321e634e9b", "token_requester": "Apple Inc.", "token_requester_id": "40010030273", "token_type": "Apple Inc.", "type": "denied_auth", "visa_trans_id": "141037867734271" }

Example: "141037867734271" Example JSON# denied_auth_bad_pan example: { "amount": "10.25", "auth_id": "12303090", "mcc": "5712", "merchant_location": "NEW YORK, NY", "merchant_name": "Widgets Incorporated", "merchant_number": "L4DIV6D5LM4X7LF", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "BPAN", "network": "V", "response_code": "05", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "tlid": "f3a54c321e634e9b", "type": "denied_auth_bad_pan", "visa_trans_id": "141037867734271" }

api_reference.title: denied_auth_gas
api_reference.description: An authorization request was denied because of insufficient funds, and the transaction was initiated at a gas pump. Available balance has not changed. Code â€” PUMP Event trigger â€” You or Galileo deny an authorization request from a gas pump because of insufficient funds. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: Galileo receives one of these messages from a card network: Preauthorization request Authorization request Fields The data elements (DEs) in the field descriptions may vary by network. All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description amount X The amount of the authorization request. Includes fees and upcharges. DE004 times the conversion rate in DE009. The amount is signed: - to debit the account and + to credit the account. Example: "10.25" auth_id X Galileo-generated ID for the authorization request. This ID is unique per subnetwork. Example: "12303090" auth_tran_type Based on DE003, processing code. Type of authorization request. See Authorization types for possible values. Example: "5" avail_cash For debit accounts, the open_to_buy plus available overdraft. Example: "143.11" avail_credit For credit accounts, the available credit limit to spend. Example: "432.00" balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" cad X Galileo-generated card ID. api_reference.title: denied_auth_inactive_card
api_reference.description: An authorization request was denied because the card is not in an active state, which means the active flag is N or the account or card status is not N. Code â€” NACT Event trigger â€” You or Galileo deny an authorization request on an inactive card. api_reference.title: direct_deposit_switch_event
api_reference.description: The status of a direct deposit switch has changed. Code â€” DDSE Event trigger â€” The status of a direct deposit switch changes. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: Account holder initiates a direct deposit switch. Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" company_payroll_provider_name X The name of the payroll provider. Example: "Home Depot" distribution_amount X The amount of the direct deposit switch. Example: "100" distribution_type X The type of amount in distribution_amount: amount or percent. Example: "percent" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "602414d84f9a1980cf5eafcc" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). api_reference.title: dispute_final_no_pc
api_reference.description: A dispute was finalized, and provisional credit had not been awarded. The outcome of the dispute is in the dispute_resolution field. The account balance has not changed. Code â€” DSFN Event trigger â€” The dispute is finalized. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: Galileo receives notification from the network or bank. Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description case_no X Identifier for the case this dispute belongs to. Example: "23082102254C" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" dispute_amount X The amount of the dispute. Example: "3245.22" dispute_id X Unique identifier for the dispute. Example: "12432" dispute_notice_date X Date on which the cardholder disputed the charge. Format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2025-04-23 13:23:04" dispute_rege_date X Due date for a Regulation E dispute. Format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2025-05-13 14:03:23" dispute_resolution X The final resolution of the dispute. Valid values: MERCHANT_CREDIT â€” Merchant credited the cardholder account CUSTOMER_LOSS â€” Dispute not settled in cardholder's favor CHARGEBACK â€” Dispute settled in cardholder's favor; amount moved into cardholder account PRTL_CHARGEBACK â€” Dispute settled in the cardholder's favor; partial amount moved into cardholder account. WRITE_OFF â€” Amount written off and awarded to cardholder dispute_resolution_date X Date on which the dispute was resolved. Example: "2025-04-29" ext_dispute_id X Dispute-system identifier for the disputed transaction. Example: "23082103202D" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "DSFN" network X See Dispute events network codes for possible values. Example: "VIS" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" settle_detail_id X ID that maps back to the settlement record for the transaction. Example: "13354855" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "dispute_final_no_pc" Example JSON# dispute_final_no_pc example: { "case_no": "23082102254C", "dispute_amount": "3245.22", "dispute_id": "12432", "dispute_notice_date": "2025-04-23 13:23:04", "dispute_rege_date": "2025-05-13 14:03:23", "dispute_resolution": "CHARGEBACK", "dispute_resolution_date": "2025-04-29", "ext_dispute_id": "23082103202D", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "DSFN", "network": "VIS", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "settle_detail_id": "13354855", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "dispute_final_no_pc" }

api_reference.title: dispute_investigation_completed
api_reference.description: The investigation of a disputed transaction has been completed. The verdict is contained in the decision field, and if the case was not decided in the account holder's favor, the deny_reason is populated. Code â€” DSIC Event trigger â€” The dispute investigation is finished. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: One or more transactions were disputed using the Dispute API or the CST. Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" claim_id X Also called the case_no, this is the caseId that was returned by Create Case. Example: "23082102254C" claim_reason X The reason for the claim. See Dispute Claim Reasons for valid values. Example: "ATMDep" decision X The final resolution of the dispute. Valid values: Denied â€” Dispute not settled in cardholder's favor. NeverPosted â€” Dispute on a pending authorization that never settled. Pay â€” Dispute settled in cardholder's favor. WriteOffPay â€” Amount written off and awarded to cardholder. deny_reason X If decision: Denied, the reason for the denial. See Dispute Deny Reasons for valid values. Example: "DuplicateDispute" dispute_amount X The current amount in dispute, including any recoveries or adjustments. Example: "60.00" dispute_id X Dispute-system transactionId, as returned by Get Transactions. Example: "23082103202D" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" investigation_complete_dt X The date on which the claim investigation was finalized. YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:dd Example: "2027-10-11 16:04:23" legacy_dispute_id The dispute_id generated by the Galileo system. Example: "2039475" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "DSIC" network X See Dispute events network codes for possible values. Example: "VIS" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" settle_detail_id X ID that maps back to the settlement record for the transaction. Example: "13354855" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "dispute_investigation_completed" Example JSON# dispute_investigation_completed example: { "claim_id": "23082102254C", "claim_reason": "ATMDep", "decision": "Denied", "deny_reason": "DuplicateDispute", "dispute_amount": "60.00", "dispute_id": "23082103202D", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "investigation_complete_dt": "2027-10-11 16:04:23", "legacy_dispute_id": "2039475", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "DSIC", "network": "VIS", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "settle_detail_id": "13354855", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "dispute_investigation_completed" }

api_reference.title: email_addr_change
api_reference.description: An email address was updated by the Program API. This event is triggered when any value is passed for the email parameter, even when the value is the same as the old value. Changes made in the CST also trigger this event. Code â€” ECHG Event trigger â€” The email field is updated. Processes â€” These processes contain the event trigger: Update Account endpoint Customer Service Tool Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description avail_cash For debit accounts, the open_to_buy plus available overdraft. Example: "143.11" avail_credit For credit accounts, the available credit limit to spend. Example: "432.00" balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" credit_balance For credit accounts, the total amount of unpaid purchases and advances. Example: "325.00" email X New email address. Example: "user@domain.com" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "ECHG" open_to_buy X The available balance to spend. Example: "500.00" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "email_addr_change" user_data Populated according to your use case and needs by arrangement with Galileo. Example JSON# email_addr_change example: { "avail_cash": "143.11", "avail_credit": "432.00", "balance_id": "20211", "credit_balance": "325.00", "email": "user@domain.com", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "ECHG", "open_to_buy": "500.00", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "email_addr_change" }

api_reference.title: expire_hold
api_reference.description: A hold that was placed on a customer account has expired. The available balance has changed. This event is triggered by the expiration of holds that you created with the Program API, the Customer Service Tool and by automated processes. For authorization hold expiry see BEXP: auth_exp. Code â€” EXHD Event trigger â€” A hold on an account expires. Processes â€” These processes contain the event trigger: Expire Hold endpoint Reverse Payment, if any payment holds exist Customer Service Tool Internal process that expires holds Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description avail_cash For debit accounts, the open_to_buy plus available overdraft. Example: "143.11" avail_credit For credit accounts, the available credit limit to spend. Example: "432.00" balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" credit_balance For credit accounts, the total amount of unpaid purchases and advances. Example: "325.00" currency Currency code for hold_amount. Example: "840" description Description for the hold. Example: "Manual hold" expiring_hold_system The system that expired the hold: CST, API or COR. Example: "CST" expiring_hold_user Identifier for the user who expired the hold, if any. Example; "user24" expiry_dt Date-time when the hold will expire. Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2025-12-02 14:10:17" hold_amount Amount of the hold. Example: "25.00" hold_id X Unique identifier for the hold. Example: "234567" hold_source The table that hold_source_id comes from. Example: "pmt_info" hold_type The transaction type (otype) of the hold. See the curated list of hold types for your program. Example: "OR" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "EXHD" open_to_buy X The available balance to spend. Example: "500.00" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "expire_hold" Example JSON# expire_hold example: { "avail_cash": "143.11", "avail_credit": "432.00", "balance_id": "20211", "credit_balance": "325.00", "currency": "840", "description": "Manual hold", "expiring_hold_system": "CST", "expiring_hold_user": "user24", "expiry_dt": "2025-12-02 14:10:17", "hold_amount": "25.00", "hold_id": "234567", "hold_source": "pmt_info", "hold_type": "OR", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "EXHD", "open_to_buy": "500.00", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "expire_hold" }

api_reference.title: fee
api_reference.description: A fee was posted to the specified account. Available balance has changed. The value for amount is positive even though the amount is debited from the account. Code â€” BFEE Event trigger â€” A fee is assessed to the account. Processes â€” These processes contain the event trigger: Program API endpoints: Assess Fee Create Account Transfer, when type includes a fee Customer Service Tool Internal fee-assessment processes Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description act_type X For all fees the activity type is "FE". amount X Amount of the fee. Example: "2.50" avail_cash For debit accounts, the open_to_buy plus available overdraft. Example: "143.11" avail_credit For credit accounts, the available credit limit to spend. Example: "432.00" balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" cad Galileo-generated card ID. Example: "12534" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" client_id ID for the customer record. Example: "264539" credit_balance For credit accounts, the total amount of unpaid purchases and advances. Example: "325.00" description X Description for the fee. Example: "Out of network ATM" ext_trans_id X External transaction ID. Example: "1234-abcdefg" fee_auth The network code and auth_id of the transaction that triggered the fee, separated by a pipe. Example: "M|123546" fee_event_id X Fee event identifier. Example: "30294" fee_id X Unique identifier for the fee. Example: "124365" merchant_number Merchant number (DE042). Example: "L4DIV6D5LM4X7LF" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "BFEE" open_to_buy X The available balance to spend. Example: "500.00" opentobuy_ts The exact date-time at which open_to_buy was captured. Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.ssssss Example: "2025-03-17 14:06:50.243654" otype X See the curated list of otypes for your program from Galileo. Example: "0013" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" sign_amount Contains - (minus sign) when the amount debits the open_to_buy. Example: "-" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "fee" user_data Populated according to your use case and needs by arrangement with Galileo. Example JSON# fee example: { "amount": "2.50", "avail_cash": "143.11", "avail_credit": "432.00", "balance_id": "20211", "cad": "12534", "client_id": "264539", "credit_balance": "325.00", "description": "Out of network ATM", "ext_trans_id": "1234-abcdefg", "fee_auth": "M|123546", "fee_event_id": "30294", "fee_id": "124365", "merchant_number": "L4DIV6D5LM4X7LF", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "BFEE", "open_to_buy": "500.00", "opentobuy_ts": "2025-03-17 14:06:50.243654", "otype": "0013", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "fee" }

api_reference.title: frozen
api_reference.description: A card was frozen. The account and card statuses were not changedâ€”only the status value in the freeze_info object was changed. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. api_reference.title: greendot_auth
api_reference.description: A Green Dot card load was authorized. Because this authorization does not take place over card-network rails, the authorization is not visible in the Authorized Transactions RDF, the Program API responses, or the CST. Code â€” GDAU Event trigger â€” Galileo approves a Green Dot card load authorization request. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: Galileo receives an API request from Green Dot to authorize a card load. Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description amount X Amount of the transaction. Unsigned. Example: "63.21" avail_cash For debit accounts, the open_to_buy plus available overdraft. Example: "143.11" avail_credit For credit accounts, the available credit limit to spend. Example: "432.00" balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" cad X Galileo-generated card ID. Example: "12534" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" confirmation_id X A confirmation ID for the Green Dot transaction. api_reference.title: insufficient_funds_to_emboss
api_reference.description: A replacement for a lost or stolen card was not embossed because there were insufficient funds in the cardholder account for the replacement fee and express mail fee, if any. The emboss record has not been created. The account will remain in status: A until sufficient funds are added to the account. Code â€” ISFE Event trigger â€” The emboss process stops because the cardholder account does not have sufficient funds for replacement fees, including express mail. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: Modify Status type 3 or 4 Replace Lost/Stolen Card Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description avail_cash For debit accounts, the open_to_buy plus available overdraft. Example: "143.11" avail_credit For credit accounts, the available credit limit to spend. Example: "432.00" balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" cad X Galileo-generated card ID. Example: "12534" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" credit_balance For credit accounts, the total amount of unpaid purchases and advances. Example: "325.00" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "ISFE" open_to_buy X The available balance to spend. Example: "500.00" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "insufficient_funds_to_emboss" Example JSON# insufficient_funds_to_emboss example: { "avail_cash": "143.11", "avail_credit": "432.00", "balance_id": "20211", "cad": "12534", "credit_balance": "325.00", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "ISFE", "open_to_buy": "500.00", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "insufficient_funds_to_emboss" }

api_reference.title: lost/stolen card no replacement
api_reference.description: A card was marked lost or stolen, and no replacement card will be issued. See the Lost, Stolen, or Damaged Cards guide for more information. Code â€” LSCN Event trigger â€” The card status is updated to L or S without triggering the replacement operation. Processes â€” These processes contain the event trigger: Modify Status endpoint with one of these type values: 8 â€” Lost, without replacement 9 â€” Stolen, without replacement Customer Service Tool Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description avail_cash For debit accounts, the open_to_buy plus available overdraft. Example: "143.11" avail_credit For credit accounts, the available credit limit to spend. Example: "432.00" balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" cad X Galileo-generated card ID. Example: "12534" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" credit_balance For credit accounts, the total amount of unpaid purchases and advances. Example: "325.00" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "LSCN" open_to_buy X The available balance to spend. Example: "500.00" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" protected_pan_four X The last four digits of the PAN. Example: "3523" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "lost/stolen card no replacement" Example JSON# lost/stolen card no replacement example: { "avail_cash": "143.11", "avail_credit": "432.00", "balance_id": "20211", "cad": "12534", "credit_balance": "325.00", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "LSCN", "open_to_buy": "500.00", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "protected_pan_four": "3523", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "lost/stolen card no replacement" }

api_reference.title: lost/stolen card with replacement
api_reference.description: A card was marked lost or stolen, and a replacement card will be issued. See the Lost, Stolen, or Damaged Cards guide for more information. Code â€” LSCR Event trigger â€” The card status is updated to L or S, and it triggers the replacement operation. Processes â€” These processes contain the event trigger: Modify Status endpoint with one of these type values: 3 â€” Lost, with replacement 4 â€” Stolen, with replacement Replace Lost/Stolen Card endpoint Customer Service Tool Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description avail_cash For debit accounts, the open_to_buy plus available overdraft. Example: "143.11" avail_credit For credit accounts, the available credit limit to spend. Example: "432.00" balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" cad X Galileo-generated card ID. Example: "12534" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" credit_balance For credit accounts, the total amount of unpaid purchases and advances. Example: "325.00" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "LSCR" new_emboss_uuid UUID for an emboss record that has not yet been sent to the embosser. Example: "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000" open_to_buy X The available balance to spend. Example: "500.00" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" protected_pan_four X The last four digits of the PAN. Example: "3523" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "lost/stolen card with replacement" user_data Populated according to your use case and needs by arrangement with Galileo. Example JSON# lost/stolen card with replacement example: { "avail_cash": "143.11", "avail_credit": "432.00", "balance_id": "20211", "cad": "12534", "credit_balance": "325.00", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "LSCR", "new_emboss_uuid": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000", "open_to_buy": "500.00", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "protected_pan_four": "3523", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "lost/stolen card with replacement" }

api_reference.title: mobile_activation ACN
api_reference.description: Mastercard has sent an activation code after an activation attempt entered the yellow path, and the cardholder followed instructions to confirm their identity. This message contains the activation code. The wallet_type field contains the mobile wallet type (Apple, Google, Samsung), and the first letter of the code also indicates the wallet type: Axxx â€” Apple Pay Gxxx â€” Google Pay Sxxx â€” Samsung Pay Codes â€” AACN, GACN, SACN Event trigger â€” Galileo receives an activation code from Mastercard (advice). Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: The cardholder performed steps to verify their identity by following the instructions in the xYLP message. Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description activation_code X One-time activation code from Mastercard. 8 digits. Example: "23649703" auth_id X Galileo-generated ID for the authorization request. This ID is unique per subnetwork. Example: "12303090" cad Galileo-generated card ID. Example: "12534" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. api_reference.title: mobile_activation API
api_reference.description: Visa has sent an activation code after an activation attempt entered the yellow path and the cardholder followed instructions to confirm their identity. This message contains the activation code. The VAPI event code is used for all mobile wallet providers. Code â€” VAPI Event trigger â€” Galileo receives an activation code from Visa. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: The cardholder performed steps to verify their identity by following the instructions in the xYLP message. Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description auth_id X Galileo-generated ID for the authorization request. This ID is unique per subnetwork. Example: "12303090" cad Galileo-generated card ID. Example: "12534" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id X Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "VAPI" network See Events Network Codes for possible values. Example: "V" passcode X One-time passcode to activate the card. 6 digits. Example: "999999" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" send_type X How the passcode was sent: email or phone. Example: "email" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "mobile_activation API" wallet_type Wallet provider. Only valid value is "Visa". Example JSON# mobile_activation API example: { "auth_id": "12303090", "cad": "12534", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "VAPI", "network": "V", "passcode": "999999", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "send_type": "email", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "mobile_activation API", "wallet_type": "Visa" }

Example: "999101003022" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "mobile_activation RDP" wallet_type X Wallet provider. Possible values: "Apple" (event code ARDP) "Google" (event code GRDP) "Samsung" (event code SRDP) Example JSON# mobile_activation RDP example: { "auth_id": "12303090", "cad": "12534", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "SRDP", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "mobile_activation RDP", "wallet_type": "Google" }

Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "mobile_activation TVN" wallet_type X Wallet provider. api_reference.title: neg_bal
api_reference.description: An account has a negative balance. The Galileo process that detects negative balances runs every morning from 03:00â€“04:00 MST. This event is sent only when MPNEG is set to Y. Compare with BBAL: bal. Code â€” BNEG Event trigger â€” The account has a negative balance today. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: Internal process that detects accounts with a negative balance. Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id X Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "BNEG" open_to_buy X The available balance to spend. Example: "-21.10" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "neg_bal" Example JSON# neg_bal example: { "balance_id": "20211", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "BNEG", "open_to_buy": "-21.10", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "neg_bal" }

api_reference.title: note
api_reference.description: A note was added to the specified account in the Customer Service Tool or by the Program API. Code â€” NOTE Event trigger â€” A note is added to the account. Processes â€” These processes contain the event trigger: Program API endpoints: Add Customer Note Add Account for an overdraft account Modify Status Get Ingo Customer ID errors Charge Off Account success Expire Authorization success Reset Card PIN Fail Count with notate: 1 Customer Service Tool Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description balance_id The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" date X Effective date-time for the note. Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2025-03-22 19:34:55" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "NOTE" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id The program ID of the account. Example: "305" text X Text of the note. Example: "Cardholder cancels dispute." type X The name of this event: "note" user X Name of the user who created the note. Example: "Jane Richards" user_data Populated according to your use case and needs by arrangement with Galileo. Example JSON# note example: { "balance_id": "20211", "date": "2025-03-22 19:34:55", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "NOTE", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "text": "Cardholder cancels dispute.", "type": "note", "user": "Jane Richards" }

api_reference.title: overdraft_authorization
api_reference.description: An authorization caused a core account to draw on its overdraft account. The balance of the core account could have been positive or negative prior to this authorization. For more information see Overdraft Workflows. Code â€” ODAA Event trigger â€” An authorization that uses overdraft funds is approved. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: You or Galileo approve an authorization request. Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "ODAA" od_f_open_to_buy Available overdraft balance minus pending fees. Example: "120.00" od_open_to_buy X Available overdraft balance. Example: "340.00" overdraft_needed The amount needed from overdraft to cover the authorization amount. Example: "26.00". pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" source_id The auth_id of the transaction that required overdraft funds. Example: "392047" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "overdraft_authorization" Example JSON# overdraft_authorization example: { "balance_id": "20211", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "ODAA", "od_f_open_to_buy": "120.00", "od_open_to_buy": "340.00", "overdraft_needed": "26.00", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "source_id": "392047", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "overdraft_authorization" }

api_reference.title: overdraft_credit_limit_change
api_reference.description: An overdraft credit limit was changed. The change occurred because of one of these conditions: Account feature 17 is changed to P (participating) and the core account meets requirements for a credit-limit increase. The credit limit is decreased. The credit limit is removed because the account no longer meets eligibility requirements. Code â€” ODCL Event trigger â€” The credit limit changes. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: Automated process that determines overdraft account activity and core account eligibility for a credit-limit adjustment Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" credlim X The adjusted overdraft credit limit. Example: "400" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "ODCL" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. api_reference.title: overdraft_limit_change

api_reference.title: overdraft_negative_balance
api_reference.description: A core account has drawn on its overdraft account for the first time since the available core balance was positive. If the available core balance is already negative, and a transaction draws on the overdraft account, this event is not triggered; instead, the ODAA: overdraft_authorization event is triggered. When the overdraft is paid off and the available core balance is zero or higher, this event will be triggered again the next time the core account draws on overdraft. For more information see Overdraft Workflows Code â€” ODNB Event trigger â€” The core account is driven negative by an authorization for the first time after being positive. Process â€” This process contains the event trigger: Authorization request over a payment network's rails Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "ODNB" od_f_open_to_buy Available overdraft balance minus pending fees. Example: "120.00" od_open_to_buy X Available overdraft balance. Example: "340.00" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: `"overdraft_negative_balance" Example JSON# overdraft_negative_balance example: { "balance_id": "20211", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "ODNB", "od_f_open_to_buy": "120.00", "od_open_to_buy": "340.00", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "overdraft_negative_balance" }

api_reference.title: overdraft_opt_in
api_reference.description: A core account is now participating in overdraft, or a core account has opted back in to overdraft. For more information see Creating an Overdraft Account. Code â€” ODIN Event trigger â€” Account feature 17 changes to P (participating). The core account is created in a participating state because ODOPT is set. An overdraft account is created with ODOPT set. The core account opts in to overdraft after previously opting out of an existing overdraft account. Processes â€” These processes contain the event trigger: Program API endpoints: Create Account for the core account with ODOPT set. Set Account Feature with featureType: 17 and featureValue: P. Add Account for the overdraft account with ODOPT set. Customer Service Tool Fields All fields are strings. Your field names may vary. Default fields are included in the default webhook template. See Default and optional fields for more information. Field Default Description balance_id X The balance ID, also called the galileo_account_number. Example: "20211" ch_group_id Corporate Hierarchy group identifier. Example: "2544" extcustid Identifier used to associate multiple accounts under the same customer. This identifier is supplied by the provider, not Galileo. Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-" msg_event_id Unique Galileo-generated identifier for this message. Example: "243693" msg_id The four-letter code to identify this event. Example: "ODIN" pmt_ref_no X Galileo 12-digit payment reference number (PRN) for the account. Example: "999101003022" prod_id X The product ID of the account. Example: "1701" prog_id X The program ID of the account. Example: "305" timestamp X Date-time when this event was created in Mountain Standard Time (GMT -0700). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss MST Example: "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST" type X The name of this event: "overdraft_opt_in" Example JSON# overdraft_opt_in example: { "balance_id": "20211", "extcustid": "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-", "msg_event_id": "243693", "msg_id": "ODIN", "pmt_ref_no": "999101003022", "prod_id": "1701", "prog_id": "305", "timestamp": "2025-01-31 17:20:33 MST", "type": "overdraft_opt_in" }
