status_codes.description: No unactivated cards found that match all parameters. No cards with an emboss status: Y match the cardholder-provided input. Cardholder must supply correct card data.
No unactivated cards found. No cards with an emboss status: Y match the PRN or customer ID. Retry with valid PRN or customer ID. Your product settings determine which value the system searches on.

Card successfully activated - However, there were were errors deactivating temporary cards. Verify that your product parameters are correct, or send a Modify Status call with type: 2 for the temporary cards.
Invalid account - account is in charged off status and cannot be modified. Account is in status: R. Inform the cardholder that the card cannot be activated.
Invalid account - account is in fraud status and cannot be modified. Account is in status: F. Inform the cardholder that the card cannot be activated.
Card not activated - card in blocked status. Account is in a status that is specified in the CRDBL parameter. Inform the cardholder that the card cannot be activated.

api_reference.title: Add Account
api_reference.description: Use the Add Account endpoint to add a secondary account to an existing customer account. The account types that may be added include savings, overdraft, account with no card, virtual card, or personalized card. Consult the Adding an Account procedure for instructions on using this endpoint. Also see Create Account vs Add Account in the About Accounts guide.

status_codes.description: Product not supported. You cannot add an account with this prodId using this endpoint. Check product settings. Check SECP on the primary product.

Customer already has this product. Your product settings (ASPRD) do not permit a customer to have multiple accounts with the same productId. Notify the customer that they cannot have multiple instances of this product.

Cannot add this product as a savings account for this card. Retry with a savings account that is valid for the primary account, check SAVPI or SAVPL for the primary account, or notify the customer that this product cannot be added.

The primary account is marked ineligible for this product. Your product settings do not permit the primary account to have this product as a secondary account. Retry with a valid primary account, notify the customer that this account is ineligible, or verify that your product settings (SECP) are correct.
Invalid real-time funding account. Input a valid 12-digit PRN of an RTF funding account.
Maximum number of secondary accounts exceeded. Product settings do not permit this many secondary accounts per primary account. Set SECLM on the secondary account to a higher number.
Secondary accounts cannot be added to secondary accounts.
Primary account is invalid. The account number in accountNo cannot be an instant-issue card.

api_reference.title: Add ACH Account
api_reference.description: Use the Add ACH Account endpoint to add an ACH account to the specified customer account. If you are integrated with Plaid, set the RPVIR parameter to 1 to receive plaid_identity_values in the response. Use this endpoint to add external accounts that belong to individuals. For accounts that belong to companies, use the Add ACH Account Corporate endpoint.

api_reference.title: Add Card
api_reference.description: Use the Add Card endpoint to add a new card (PAN and CAD) to an existing PRN. Cards that are created with this endpoint are active upon creation, and the account status is updated to the second position of XAACT. Galileo recommends that you have only one active card per PRN. As needed, ensure that any previous card has been marked lost, stolen, canceled, or any status but N. Do not use this endpoint to create multiple spending cards that share a central balance. For that use case, Galileo recommends Real-Time Funding or Corporate Credit for large numbers of cards, or for small numbers of cards you can create one primary and multiple secondary accounts that share a balance. Use this endpoint in scenarios such as these: Replacing a virtual card that is lost, stolen, or expired Adding another virtual card to a PRN Replacing an instant-issue card at a storefront (for card programs with a retail integration) Replacing a personalized card

api_reference.title: Add Paper Biller
api_reference.description: Use the Add Paper Biller endpoint to create a custom paper biller for a customer and to schedule paper bill payments. Billers that are created with this endpoint will receive a paper check instead of an electronic payment. The account must be active (status: N) to use this endpoint. See Creating a Billpay Transaction for further instructions on using this endpoint.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: billerName
parameters.description: Display name for the biller. You can have duplicate billerNames as long as the addresses are different. Pattern: Max 50 alphanumeric characters, no punctuation Example: "My Landlord"

parameters.name: billerAddress1
parameters.description: First line of the biller address. Pattern: Min of 3 and Max 80 alphanumeric characters Example: "33 Maple Street"

parameters.name: billerAddress2
parameters.description: Second line of biller address. Pattern: Max 30 alphanumeric characters Example: "#4B"

parameters.name: billerCity
parameters.description: Biller city. Pattern: Max 30 letters and spaces Example: "Salt Lake City"

parameters.name: billerState
parameters.description: Biller state or province. Pattern: 2-character state or provincial abbreviation Example: "UT"

parameters.name: billerZip
parameters.description: Biller postal code. Pattern: 12345, 12345-1234, or K1A-1A1 Example: "84121"

parameters.name: billerPhone
parameters.description: Biller phone number or "null". Pattern: Exactly 10 digits, no hyphens or other characters or "null" Example: "8013656060"

parameters.name: billerAccountNo
parameters.description: Account number that the account holder has with the biller. This value is not validated against a formatting mask. If there is no account number for the biller, pass n/a. You cannot edit this value with Modify Paper Biller. If the account holder submits an incorrect value, you must remove the biller and create the biller again with the correct account number. Pattern: Alphanumeric string including hyphens and spaces. Example: "3333223323455555"

parameters.name: frequencyType
parameters.description: Frequency of the bill payment: O â€” One time W â€” Weekly M â€” Monthly Q â€” Quarterly Y â€” Yearly If this value is not O then nextDate and endDate are required. Pattern: One letter Example: "W"

parameters.name: nextDate
parameters.description: The next date that the payment is scheduled. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD Example: "2015-02-04"

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The last date that the payment is scheduled. Can be up to five years in the future, so if today is 20 Jan 2020, this parameter can be no later than 20 Jan 2025. However, if today's date is a leap day, such as 29 Feb 2020, the latest date can be 1 Mar 2025. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD Example: "2015-02-04"

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Currency amount as a whole or decimal amount. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

api_reference.title: Charge Off Account
api_reference.description: Use the Charge Off Account endpoint to charge off the specified account (sweep funds and set balance to 0.00) and move the account to status: R (charged off). These are the rules for using the chargeOffDetails parameter: chargeOffDetails accepts a JSON-formatted list with chargeOffAmount and chargeOffReason as the two keys. The only valid values for chargeOffReason are the numerals 1-13, as shown in the chargeOffReason table. chargeOffAmount is a float that must be greater than 0. If you pass 0 the request will fail. chargeOffAmount is required when chargeOffReason does not equal 1. Example: [{"chargeOffAmount": 2.6, "chargeOffReason": 5}, {"chargeOffAmount": 4.75, "chargeOffReason": 2}] To recover a charged-off account use the Recover Charged-Off Account endpoint.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Do not use the PRN if more than one card has ever been associated with this account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: chargeOffDetails
parameters.description: A JSON object containing a list of charge-off details. See the endpoint description above for details. Pattern: JSON format (list of dictionaries) Example: "[{"chargeOffAmount": 2.6, "chargeOffReason": 5}, {"chargeOffAmount": 4.75, "chargeOffReason": 2}]"

parameters.name: closeAssociatedAccounts

PIN change has not been started. Must call getCardPinChangeKey prior to using this end point. Restart the process, beginning with calling Get Card PIN Change Key.

api_reference.title: Complete Enrollment
api_reference.description: Use the Complete Enrollment endpoint to finalize an incomplete enrollment that was begun by Start Enrollment or Create Account. You must pass the same transactionId as the original Start Enrollment or Create Account request. ðŸ“˜NoteIf this endpoint returns a status code that does not match a status code that is specific to this endpoint, it may be an enrollment status code. See Enrollment Statuses for more information.

api_reference.title: Create Account
api_reference.description: Use the Create Account endpoint to create an account for a new customer. You can use this endpoint for personalized, instant issue, and secondary products. This endpoint runs CIP if you are using Galileo's integrated CIP process. In contrast with the Start Enrollment endpoint, Create Account creates a customer record and at the same time creates an account. Depending on product settings, it also creates a card and loads funds onto it. Consult the Creating an Account procedure for instructions on using this endpoint, and consult the Customer ID Verification guide for how to use this endpoint with Galileo's integrated CIP solution. The instructions include a flowchart to illustrate how Create Account works in the Galileo system. Also see Create Account vs Add Account in the About Accounts guide. ðŸ“˜NoteYou can receive PCI-sensitive data only if your provider parameters permit it. Duplicate use of customer ID Galileo can configure your product parameters to allow or disallow the duplicate use of customer IDs such as SSNs across your programs. (If one of your prospective customers already has a product with another Galileo partner, no duplicate is detected.) CIP response If you are using Galileo's integrated CIP solution, the Create Account response includes the verdict. Consult Create Account and Create Virtual Account Process in the Customer ID Verification (CIP/KYC) guide for more information. Test names in the CV environment In the CV environment only, you can use specific names with the Create Account endpoint to trigger different CIP responses. For the firstName, middleName, and lastName parameters, use these values: John F Smith â€” Triggers a CIP failure (F) John R Smith â€” Triggers a CIP refer (R) John P Smith â€” Triggers a CIP pass (P) Do not use these test names in Production. Required fields Most input parameters for this endpoint are not required, to accommodate various use cases. If you would like some of the parameters to be required, populate the PINED product parameter with the parameters to be required. For example: idType,id. If this endpoint returns a status code that does not match a status code that is specific to this endpoint, it may be an enrollment status code. See Enrollment Statuses for more information.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: idType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of primary identifier in the id parameter. This parameter is required when id is populated. See the ID column in the Customer ID Types table for valid values. Pattern: 1- or 2-digit integer Example: 2

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The value of the primary identifier that is specified in idType. Product settings determine whether thisPrimary ID for the account holder. This parameter is required when using Galileo's integrated CIP solution. Galileo converts all letters to lowercase. Pattern: As specified in the Layout column of the Customer ID Types enumeration Example: "123456789"

parameters.name: idType2
parameters.description: Specifies the type of secondary identifier in the id2 parameter. This parameter is required when id2 is populated. See the ID column in the Customer ID Types table for valid values. Pattern: 1- or 2-digit integer Example: 1

parameters.name: id2
parameters.description: The value of the secondary identifier that is specified in idType2. Galileo converts all letters to lowercase. Pattern: As specified in the Layout column of the Customer ID Types enumeration Example: "123456789012|ut|12/25/2020"

parameters.name: locationType
parameters.description: Type of ID in location: 0 â€” Galileo location ID 1 â€” Partner location ID 2 â€” Don't validate Pattern: Integer Example: 0

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Unique location identifier (location) as returned by the Create Location endpoint. This value is also returned by the Get Locations endpoint depending on the value of locationType when the location was created: 0 or 2 â€” Returned in the location_id field 1 â€” Returned in the provider_specified_id field Pattern: Integer if locationType: 0 or locationType: 2; max 15 characters if locationType: 1 Example: "a455-3483"

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The account holder language and localization preference. Valid values are en_US, es_US, fr_CA, en_CA, es_MX, en_MX. If the account holder address is outside the U.S., pass a non _US value for this parameter to disable U.S. address validation. Pattern: Letters with underscore Example: "en_US"

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: Identifier supplied by the provider, which is not related to the Galileo system. This ID is stored in the Galileo system in association with this account and can be provided in the RDFs. Pattern: Max 30 alphanumeric characters. Lowercase only. Example: "553b45sbs"

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Account holder's first name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "Ed"

parameters.name: middleName
parameters.description: Account holder's middle name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "W"

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Account holder's last name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "Harley"

parameters.name: dateOfBirth
parameters.description: Account holder's birth date. This date is compared with the DOB product parameter when there is a minimum age requirement on the account. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD Example: "1980-01-01"

parameters.name: address1
parameters.description: Account holder's first address line. Cannot be a P.O. box. Validation rules for address1. Pattern: 4â€“40 alphanumeric characters Example: "33 Maple Street"

parameters.name: address2
parameters.description: Account holder's second address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 40 characters Example: "#4B"

parameters.name: address3
parameters.description: Account holder's third address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: "Carrera Central"

parameters.name: address4
parameters.description: Account holder's fourth address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: "Barrio El Alhambra"

parameters.name: address5
parameters.description: Account holder's fifth address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: "Piso 3"

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Account holder's city. Pattern: Max 30 characters: letters, spaces, hyphen and period Example: "Salt Lake City"

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Account holder's state or province. Pattern: 2,3-character state or province abbreviation Example: "UT"

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Account holder's postal code (ZIP code). Pattern: 1234, 12345, 12345-1234, or K1A-1A1 Example: "84121"

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Account holder's country. Three-digit UN M49 code, such as 840 for USA, 124 for Canada, 484 for Mexico, 170 for Colombia. Pattern: 3-digit number Example: "840"

parameters.name: primaryPhone
parameters.description: Account holder's primary phone number. When passing a value for this parameter, you must also pass mobilePhoneCountryCode. Pattern: Validation according to the value in mobilePhoneCountryCode. Example: "8015556060"

parameters.name: otherPhone
parameters.description: Account holder's secondary phone number. When passing a value for this parameter, you must also pass mobilePhoneCountryCode. Pattern: Validation according to the value in mobilePhoneCountryCode. Example: "8015556060"

parameters.name: mobilePhone
parameters.description: Account holder's mobile phone number. When passing a value for this parameter, you must also pass mobilePhoneCountryCode. Pattern: Validation according to the value in mobilePhoneCountryCode. Example: "8015556060"

parameters.name: mobileCarrierId
parameters.description: Account holder's mobile carrier. Configurable list. Pattern: Configurable list Example: "8"

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Account holder's email. The Python implementation uses Marshmallow validation for this field. For the PHP implementation, contact Galileo. Pattern: Email address, 3â€“63 characters Example: "user@fakedomain.com"

parameters.name: webUid
parameters.description: Account holder's username for the Galileo-hosted website. Must be unique across the program. Pattern: Alphanumeric, with first character a letter; case insensitive Example: "eharley"

parameters.name: webPwd
parameters.description: Account holder's password for the Galileo-hosted website. Pattern: Min 8 characters: must include upper-case character, lower-case character, and a number Example: "4j9KH3kkdh"

parameters.name: secretQuestion
parameters.description: Account holder's secret question for the Galileo-hosted website. Pattern: Max 50 characters: letters, spaces, ? Example: "What was the name of your first pet?"

parameters.name: secretAnswer
parameters.description: Account holder's answer to secretQuestion. Pattern: Max 50 characters: letters, spaces, ? Example: "Larry"

parameters.name: incomeSource
parameters.description: Account holder's employer name or income source. Pattern: Max 60 characters: alphanumeric, space, underscore, hyphen, period, @, & and comma. Example: "Kroger Food & Drug"

parameters.name: occupation
parameters.description: Account holder's occupation. Pattern: Max 60 characters: alphanumeric, space, underscore, hyphen, period, @, & and comma. Example: "Project Manager"

parameters.name: monthlyIncome
parameters.description: Monthly Income for the Account holder

parameters.name: externalCustomerId
parameters.description: Identifier supplied by the provider, which is not related to the Galileo system. Pattern: Max 512 characters: all ASCII characters Example: "acv#-@45!sbsxm%-"

parameters.name: prodId
parameters.description: Galileo-generated identifier for a product. If this ID is for a business product then businessName is required. Pattern: Integer Example: 501

parameters.name: loadAmount
parameters.description: Currency amount passed as a whole or decimal amount. Initial load amount on a card must be within product load limits or be the designated amount for an instant-issue card. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100 or 100.73

parameters.name: loadType
parameters.description: Transaction type for the loadAmount. Use values from your Galileo-supplied list of load types. If no loadType is specified, the default type RL is used. Pattern: 2 characters Example: "RL"

parameters.name: primaryAccount
parameters.description: PAN or PRN of the primary account to associate this account with. Populate this parameter only when creating a secondary account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "123456789012"

parameters.name: fundingAccountNo
parameters.description: PRN of the RTF funding account. Required if prodId is an RTF spending product. Pattern: 12-digit numeric string Example: "143101204201"

parameters.name: sharedBalance
parameters.description: Specifies whether the secondary account will share the balance of the primary account. This parameter is required when primaryAccount is populated. Do not set this parameter to 1 when primaryAccount is not populated. 0 â€” Do not share the balance 1 â€” Share the balance Pattern: Integer Example: 1

parameters.name: authorizedUser
parameters.description: Specifies whether the account is an authorized user. This parameter requires primaryAccount and sharedBalance to be populated. 0 â€” Do not mark this account as authorized user 1 â€” Mark this account as authorized user Pattern: Integer Example: 1

parameters.name: userData
parameters.description: Data supplied by the provider, from sources external to the Galileo system. This data will be stored in the Galileo system in association with this account. The most common use of this parameter is to track affiliate-marketing traffic. The data in this field can be added to an RDF. Pattern: Max 50 alphanumeric characters and spaces Example: "a4434gg44"

parameters.name: verifyOnly

parameters.description: CIP setting override. Valid only if you are using Galileo's integrated CIP solution. "0" or empty â€” Do not override the CIP setting. "1" â€” Create the customer record and run CIP but do not create an account. "2" â€” Create the customer record and account but do not run CIP. Example: "0"

parameters.name: expressMail

parameters.description: Pass 1 to always ship cards to the ship-to address instead of one time only. Pattern: 1 or 0 Example: "1"

parameters.name: shipToAddress2

parameters.name: shipToCity
parameters.description: Ship-to city. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: "Salt Lake City"

parameters.name: shipToPostalCode

parameters.name: shipToCountryCode
parameters.description: Ship-to country. Three-digit UN M49 country code, such as 840 for USA, 124 for Canada, 484 for Mexico, 170 for Colombia. Pattern: 3-digit number Example: "840"

parameters.name: businessName
parameters.description: Account holder's business name. This field is required if prodId is a business product. Pattern: 2-150 characters. See the supported character set. Example: "Ed%26Ted"

parameters.name: mobilePhoneCountryCode
parameters.description: Account holder's mobile phone country code. Pattern: A plus sign followed by 1â€“3 digits. See Phone Validation for valid values. Example: "+1"

status_codes.description: Preferred Name not supported for this product. Resend without preferredName or displayPreferredNameOnlyOnCard in the request.
Customer already has this product issued. The product has already been created with this same id value. Check VLDLV for the level at which id must be unique.
Invalid instant issue card. An attempt was made to use an instant-issue card that has already been sold. Retry with an unissued instant-issue card number.
Load amount outside of load limits. Too much money is being loaded. Retry with an appropriate amount in loadAmount, or check your maxLimit and minLimit settings.
Could not create account. Contact Galileo for troubleshooting.
Could not load card. Contact Galileo for troubleshooting.
Primary account is invalid. The account number in primaryAccount cannot be an instant-issue card.
Secondary accounts cannot be added to secondary accounts.
Maximum number of secondary accounts exceeded. Product settings do not permit this many secondary accounts per primary account. Set SECLM on the secondary account to a higher number.
ID type 2 is required as main ID for running CIP. Product settings require idType: 2 (SSN/SIN) to run Galileo's integrated customer ID verification. Pass a SSN in id. Controlled by VLDLV.

Account created, ID validation failed. Customer's personal info has failed the ID check. Take action depending on the result in the response: F â€” Fail. Take no action: the customer does not qualify for an account.R â€” Refer. Depending on your arrangements with Galileo, request valid documents from the customer or wait for Galileo's third-party CIP to complete.
An application with the same ID has already been submitted. Duplicate SSNs were used for enrollment. Follow your business plan for this outcome. Controlled by VLDLV.

Application successfully started and CIP run. The cipStatus parameter was set to 1, the application was successfully started, and CIP was run. An account was not created. Take action depending on the result in the response:P â€” Pass. Contact Galileo for instructions on creating the account. Do not run Create Account again.F â€” Fail. Take no action: the customer does not qualify for an account.R â€” Refer. Depending on your arrangement with Galileo, request valid documents from the customer or wait for Galileo's third-party CIP to complete.
Success -- partial limit violation. Only the amount permitted by product settings was loaded.
Success -- delayed payment. The account was created but funds were not loaded onto the card because of limit violations. An attempt will be made tomorrow to load the card.
Card is marked as fraudulent. Used for instant-issue cards which have been swiped before issuance. Retry with another instant-issue card.

Card not allocated to your store for issuance. The location does not match the location that this batch of cards was created for. Change the location on the account or retry with another instant-issue account number.
Specified load from account number is invalid. The loadFromAccountNo parameter contained an account number that does not exist in the Galileo system. Retry with valid account number.
A load was attempted for a non-positive amount. A negative load amount was passed. Retry with a positive amount.
The prodId for the secondary account is not allowed. Product parameters do not permit the prodId to be a secondary account for the account in primaryAccount. Check SECP on the primary account.
Invalid real-time funding account. fundingAccountNo must contain an RTF funding account.

api_reference.title: Create Account Transfer
api_reference.description: Use the Create Account Transfer endpoint to move funds between accounts in the same program. You can combine a fee with the payment or adjustment, depending on what transaction types you have set up with Galileo. The accounts can belong to the same customer or different customers. If the accounts are in different programs, verify that the program parameters permit transferring funds between the programs. Pass the sending account in the accountNo parameter and the receiving account in the transferToAccountNo parameter. The receiving account should be in status: N (active) and the active flag set to Y. To permit this endpoint to drive the sending account negative, set the ALWNB parameter on the sending product. Consult the Creating an Internal Transfer guide for instructions on using this endpoint.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the sending account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Currency amount as a whole or decimal amount. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: transferToAccountNo

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: A message for the transfer recipient. The C2DSC provider parameter must be set to 1 to populate this parameter. If you do not populate this parameter, it defaults to the value in the BMNAM product parameter. Galileo truncates this field to 80 characters. Pattern: Max 80 alphanumeric characters, including punctuation, special characters and international characters Example: "Thanks again for lunch!"

parameters.name: senderMessage
parameters.description: A message for the transfer sender. The C2DSC provider parameter must be set to 1 to populate this parameter. If you do not populate this parameter, it defaults to the value in message. Pattern: Max 80 alphanumeric characters, including punctuation, special characters and international characters Example: "Thanks again for lunch!"

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Transaction type for the transfer. Use the values provided by Galileo for your program. Pattern: Max 3 alphanumeric characters, case-sensitive Example: "MRM"

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

parameters.name: processing_time
parameters.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

parameters.name: provider_timestamp
parameters.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

parameters.name: provider_transaction_id
parameters.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

parameters.name: system_timestamp
parameters.description: A system generated timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: old_balance
parameters.description: The old balance on the source account

parameters.name: new_balance
parameters.description: The new balance on the source account

parameters.name: adjustment_trans_id
parameters.description: The transaction ID for the debit

parameters.name: transfer_account_id
parameters.description: The recipient account of the transfer

parameters.name: sender_fee_amount
parameters.description: The C2C fee applied to the transfer, if any

parameters.name: payment_trans_id
parameters.description: The transaction ID for the credit

status_codes.description: The transfer-to account could not be found. Retry with a valid account number in transferToAccountNo or inform the customer that the receiving account does not exist.
Invalid transfer-to account. Verify that the receiving account is status: N, or inform the customer that the receiving account is ineligible to receive funds.
The transfer-to account product is not authorized. Inform the customer that the receiving account is not eligible to receive funds.
Sender velocity check failure. Moving funds out of this account violates its velocity limits. Inform the customer that they cannot make this transfer.
Recipient velocity check failure. Moving funds into this account violates its velocity limits. Inform the customer that they cannot make this transfer.
Sender insufficient balance. The value in amount is higher than the sending account's available funds. Inform the customer that they do not have sufficient funds to make this transfer.

Invalid/unconfigured cross program transfer. The sending and receiving accounts have different program_ids, and settings do not permit transfers between these programs. Verify that your program settings permit transfers between the two programs, or inform the customer that they cannot transfer funds between those two accounts.
Previous attempt found in process. Did not process current request. Do not retry.

api_reference.title: Create ACH Transaction
api_reference.description: Use the Create ACH Transaction endpoint to originate an ACH transaction to move funds between a customer account (accountNo) and an existing ACH bank account (achAccountId). Use the Add ACH Account endpoint to add an ACH bank account. For more information on this endpoint see Creating an ACH transaction in the ACH Endpoints guide.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: achAccountId
parameters.description: ACH account identifier (ach_account_id), as returned by the Add ACH Account or Get ACH Accounts endpoint. Pattern: Positive integer Example: 354656

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Currency amount as a whole or decimal amount. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description for the ACH transfer. Pattern: Alphanumeric and punctuation, max 30 characters Example: One time payroll load.

parameters.name: remittanceInfo
parameters.description: Populate with any available context for the ACH payment. Galileo populates the value within the Payment Related Information fieldof the ACH Addenda Record in the outgoing ACH file. Pattern: Alphanumeric and punctuation, max 80 characters Example: "Payoff 2500 transfer initiated and verified to Acct 12345678."

parameters.name: debitCreditIndicator
parameters.description: Specifies whether the recipient account is to be credited or debited. Default: D. C â€” Credit D â€” Debit Pattern: D or C Example: D

parameters.name: authorizationMethod
parameters.description: Specifies the authorization method to be used. online_or_mobile â€” Website or Mobile App written_or_prearranged â€” Signed Document, Agreement, or Standing Auth other â€” Not Digital/Web/Mobile or Prearranged Note: for B2C transactions, authorizationMethod is set as other (SEC Code: PPD) unless specified otherwise. If the provided authorizationMethod is invalid, authorizationMethod will still be set as other for B2C. Pattern: online_or_mobile, written_or_prearranged, or other Example: online_or_mobile

parameters.name: sameDay
parameters.description: Specifies whether this is a same-day transaction. Pattern: Y or N Example: Y

parameters.name: identNumber
parameters.description: Provider-supplied identifier, external to the Galileo system. This value is only required for the CIE and WEB SEC codes. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "123456789"

parameters.name: processorToken
parameters.description: Obtained from Plaid if using Plaid integration. Checks the balance of the ACH account to verify that there are sufficient funds for an ACH debit. Pattern: String Example: "processor-production-35cd43b-adfc-d8aa-b331-c9ba0fdha881"

parameters.name: holdDays
parameters.description: The number of hold days to apply to this transaction, which overrides the hold days in product settings. This value applies only to outgoing ACH debits (debitCreditIndicator: D). This parameter is available only to clients who have obtained bank approval to use it. The ACOHD parameter must be set to use this parameter. Pattern: Positive integer Example: 2

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

parameters.name: processing_time
parameters.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

parameters.name: provider_timestamp
parameters.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

parameters.name: provider_transaction_id
parameters.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

parameters.name: system_timestamp
parameters.description: A system generated timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: balance
parameters.description: Reflects the pre-transaction amount on the account. For outgoing credits the balance adjustment occurs almost instantly but the response shows the balance before the transaction. For outgoing debits, the balance update is delayed until the hold period expires.

parameters.name: ach_transaction_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the ACH transaction

status_codes.description: ACH account not found
Insufficient balance. The Galileo account does not have enough funds for the outgoing credit.
Limit violation
Insufficient funds for debit transaction. Plaid integration only: The remote account does not have sufficient funds for the outgoing debit.
Plaid returned an error. Find the error in the status field and handle with Plaid accordingly.
Failure occurred while processing debit transaction
Failure occurred while processing credit transaction
Previous attempt found in process. Did not process current request. Do not retry.
Invalid ACH account

api_reference.title: Create Adjustment
api_reference.description: Use the Create Adjustment endpoint to move funds into or out of a customer account. Transactions using this endpoint are returned by the Get Account Overview endpoint only after several seconds have elapsed. To drive an account negative using this endpoint, set the ALWNB parameter at the provider level. ðŸš§WarningThis endpoint requires a positive integer less than 9223372036854775807 (sys.maxint in Python 2 or sys.maxsize in Python 3) for transactionId rather than the alphanumeric string that all other endpoints use. The Reverse Adjustment endpoint uses this integer to identify the transaction to reverse out.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique integer ID for the transaction. Pattern: 64-byte integer Example: 164736451002

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Currency amount as a whole or decimal amount. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The transaction type for the adjustment. Use the values provided by Galileo for your program. Pattern: 1- or 2-character alphanumeric, case-sensitive Example: "le"

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description for the transaction. Pattern: 1â€“40 alphanumeric characters, including punctuation Example: "One time payroll load."

parameters.name: debitCreditIndicator
parameters.description: Specifies whether this transaction credits or debits the account in accountNo: C â€” Credit D â€” Debit Pattern: String Example: "D"

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Unique location identifier (location) as returned by the Create Location endpoint. This value is also returned by the Get Locations endpoint depending on the value of locationType when the location was created: 0 or 2 â€” Returned in the location_id field 1 â€” Returned in the provider_specified_id field Pattern: Integer if locationType: 0 or locationType: 2; max 15 characters if locationType: 1 Example: "a455-3483"

parameters.name: locationType
parameters.description: Type of ID in location: 0 â€” Galileo location ID 1 â€” Partner location ID 2 â€” Don't validate Pattern: Integer Example: 0

parameters.name: verifyOnly
parameters.description: Pass 1 to test the validity of the parameter data without committing the information to the Galileo system. Pattern: Integer Example: 0

parameters.name: includeRtfTransfer
parameters.description: Specifies whether the amount in this transaction should be transferred to or from the RTF funding account that is associated with this RTF spending account. Default: 1 0 â€” Do not perform an RTF transfer for this amount 1 â€” Perform an RTF transfer for this amount. Pattern: Integer Example: "1"

parameters.name: disputeId
parameters.description: External dispute ID, to be used by dispute providers only. Pattern: 1-16 alphanumeric characters Example: "21010000000D"

parameters.name: enforceTransactionLimits
parameters.description: Pass 1 to enforce any adjustment transaction limits. Pattern: Integer Example: 0

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

parameters.name: processing_time
parameters.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

parameters.name: provider_timestamp
parameters.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

parameters.name: provider_transaction_id
parameters.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

parameters.name: system_timestamp
parameters.description: A system generated timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: old_balance
parameters.description: The balance on the account before the transaction

parameters.name: new_balance
parameters.description: The balance on the account after the transaction

parameters.name: adjustment_trans_id
parameters.description: Galileo generated adjustment transaction ID

status_codes.description: The transactionId parameter must be an integer value. Verify that transactionId is a positive integer less than 9223372036854775807 (sys.maxint in Python 2 or sys.maxsize in Python 3).
Cardholder not configured for overdraft. The cardholder account is not participating in overdraft. featureType 17 must be P.
Cardholder product not configured for overdraft. The prod_id for this account does not support overdraft.
Insufficient overdraft funds. The account supports overdraft, but there are not enough funds in the overdraft account for this transaction.
Error transferring overdraft funds. The system attempted to transfer funds from the overdraft account to cover the amount of this transaction, but it failed.
Cardholder overdraft configuration error. The overdraft account is not configured for adjustments.
Insufficient balance for cascading transaction. Product settings (ALWNB) do not permit this endpoint to drive the account negative.
The transactionId parameter must less than or equal to 23 char.
Transaction limit exceeded.

api_reference.title: Create Bill Payment
api_reference.description: Use the Create Bill Payment endpoint to create a bill payment transaction. Before you can use this endpoint, you must create the biller. api_reference.title: Create Federal Benefit Enrollment
api_reference.description: Use the Create Federal Benefit Enrollment endpoint to initiate the process for the specified customer to receive U.S. federal benefit funds via ACH deposit. All enrollments that you initiate with this endpoint are queued into a batch file that is sent regularly (usually daily) to the federal government for processing. ðŸ“˜NoteThis endpoint automatically creates a secondary account for benefits deposits that shares its balance with the primary account.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Unique location identifier; see location types. Pattern: Must be a number if type is 0; Must be less than 15 characters if type is 1. Example: "a455-3483"

parameters.name: locationType
parameters.description: 0=Galileo Location ID 1=Partner Location ID Pattern: 0 or 1 Example: 1

parameters.name: recipientType
parameters.description: Specifies whether the owner of the account in accountNo is a direct recipient or a beneficiary: 0 â€” Direct recipient 1 â€” Beneficiary Pattern: 0 or 1 Example: 1

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Account holder's first name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "Ed"

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Account holder's last name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "Harley"

parameters.name: ssn
parameters.description: The Social Security number of the direct recipient of the disbursement. Pattern: 9-digit Social Security number, no hyphens Example: "123456789"

parameters.name: agencyType
parameters.description: One of several defined agency types. Pattern: See the Federal Benefit Enrollment Agency Types table in Enumerations. Example: "SOCIAL SECURITY"

parameters.name: alerts
parameters.description: Specifies whether to send alerts regarding the enrollment process. Pattern: 0 or 1 Example: 1

parameters.name: agentId
parameters.description: Identifier of the agent, for use in transaction reporting and tracking. Pattern: Integer Example: 109405

parameters.name: middleName
parameters.description: Middle name of the beneficiary.Middle names are not used in ENR transactions, but they are included here for parity between the Account Management and Federal Benefit Enrollment data models. Pattern: String Example: James

api_reference.title: Create Group
api_reference.description: Use the Create Group endpoint to create a root group or a non-root group. When creating a root group, populate these parameters to create the business profile: businessLegalName doingBusinessAs phoneCountryCode phone primaryContactEmail primaryContactName When creating a non-root group, you can populate the business-profile parameters as desired. All of the name parameters support the Latin-9 (ISO-8859-15) character set. See Creating a Corporate Hierarchy for instructions on using this endpoint.

parameters.name: apiLogin

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId

parameters.name: groupName
parameters.description: Name of the group. Pattern: 1â€“40 alphanumeric characters, including spaces, hyphens, and single quotes Example: "CDE Corp"

parameters.name: parentGroupId
parameters.description: The identifier of the next group up in the hierarchy. Required when creating a non-root group; not valid when maxLevel is populated. This value cannot be changed after it is set .Pattern: Max 10 numeric characters Example: "456"

parameters.name: maxLevel
parameters.description: Maximum number of subgroup levels that can be created below this root group. Required when creating a root group. Not valid when parentGroupId is populated. This value cannot be changed to a smaller number after it is set. Pattern: Numerals 0â€“5 Example: 3

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: Provider-specified identifier for the group. Pattern: Max 30 alphanumeric characters Example: "L0000"

parameters.name: doingBusinessAs
parameters.description: Operating name of the company, if different from businessLegalName. Pattern: 2â€“150 alphanumeric characters, as shown in businessName parameter Example: "SportsBall Enterprises"

parameters.name: businessLegalName
parameters.description: Legal name of the business. Pattern: 2â€“150 alphanumeric characters, as shown in businessName parameter Example: "CDE Corporation, Inc."

parameters.name: phoneCountryCode

parameters.name: phone

parameters.name: primaryContactName
parameters.description: The name of the primary point of contact at businessLegalName. Pattern: 2â€“150 Latin-9 characters Example: "Maxina Seward"

parameters.name: primaryContactEmail

api_reference.title: Create Hold
api_reference.description: Use the Create Hold endpoint to create a hold (reserve) on an amount of funds for a specified payment, or to create a hold on an account in general. This endpoint supports remote deposit capture (RDC). To create a hold on a specific payment you must pass amount and pmtId. The default hold limit is 1 000 000. You can override this limit with the MXHLD program parameter. To create a hold on an account, your program parameters (THOLD) must specify that an account hold is valid for the holdType parameter. This endpoint does not create authorization holds on an account for card-association transactions â€” such holds are created automatically when an authorization request is approved.

api_reference.title: Create Location
api_reference.description: Use the Create Location endpoint to create a new store location, associated with a provider-specific ID, and nest it below a parent location (store). The first location you create will be designated location 0, the top-level location.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the location. Pattern: Max 85 characters: letters, numbers, spaces, _ (underscore), ' (single quote), - (hyphen), . (period). All other characters will be removed. Example: "ABC Store 5"

parameters.name: address1
parameters.description: First address line of the location. Pattern: 4â€“40 alphanumeric characters Example: "33 Maple Street"

parameters.name: address2
parameters.description: Second address line of the location. Pattern: Max 30 alphanumeric characters Example: "#4B"

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: City for the location. Pattern: Max 30 characters: letters, spaces, hyphen and period Example: "Salt Lake City"

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: State or province for the location. Pattern: 2-character state or province abbreviation Example: "UT"

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Postal (ZIP) code for the location. Pattern: 12345, 12345-1234, K1A-1A1 Example: "84121"

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: TCountry for the location. Three-digit UN M49 code, such as 840 for USA, 124 for Canada, 484 for Mexico, 170 for Colombia. Pattern: Three-digit country code Example: "840"

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Phone number of the location. Pattern: Exactly 10 digits, no hyphens or other characters Example: "8013656060"

parameters.name: parentLocation
parameters.description: Identifier for the parent location. The first time you create a location, pass 0. Pattern: Integer if parentLocationType: 0; max 15 characters if parentLocationType: 1 Example: "5"

parameters.name: parentLocationType
parameters.description: The type of location specified in parentLocation. If parentLocation is the top-level value from Galileo, then pass 0 for this parameter. 0 â€” Galileo location ID 1 â€” Partner location ID 2 â€” Don't validate Pattern: 0, 1 or 2 Example: 0

parameters.name: providerSpecifiedId
parameters.description: The provider-supplied identifier for a location, when parentLocationType: 1. Pattern: Max 15 alphanumeric characters Example: "abc-123"

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Location status. Default N: C â€” Closed N â€” Active S â€” Suspended n â€” New Pattern: Single character, case-sensitive Example: "N"

parameters.name: store_type
parameters.description: The store or location type. Default 5: 1 â€” Corporate 2 â€” Chain 3 â€” Reseller 4 â€” Region 5 â€” Store Pattern: Single digit or null Example: "5"

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code

api_reference.title: Create Location Fee
api_reference.description: Use the Create Location Fee endpoint to create a fee to assess at a location. A fee can be assessed as a flat rate or a percentage. When the fee is a percentage, you can specify minimum and maximum amounts. The fee becomes active upon creation and can be deactivated using the Modify Location Fee endpoint. These are the fee types: FBD â€” FBE direct deposit fee DEL â€” ACH direct deposit fee

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Unique location identifier (location) as returned by the Create Location endpoint. This value is also returned by the Get Locations endpoint depending on the value of locationType when the location was created: 0 or 2 â€” Returned in the location_id field 1 â€” Returned in the provider_specified_id field Pattern: Integer if locationType: 0 or locationType: 2; max 15 characters if locationType: 1 Example: "a455-3483"

parameters.name: locationType
parameters.description: Type of ID in location: 0 â€” Galileo location ID 1 â€” Partner location ID 2 â€” Don't validate Pattern: 0, 1, or 2 Example: 0

parameters.name: feeType
parameters.description: Type of fee to assess at this location. To set up both fee types at the same location, call this endpoint twice: FBD â€” Federal benefit enrollment direct-deposit fee DEL â€” ACH direct-deposit fee Pattern: 3-character code Example: "FBD"

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Specify either a flat amount or a percentage. For a flat amount the valid range is between .01 and 999. For a percentage the valid range is .01 (1%) to 1 (100%). When this parameter is populated then amountType is required. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 1.23

parameters.name: amountType
parameters.description: Specify which type of value is in amount: flat â€” Flat rate percent â€” Percentage Pattern: String Example: "flat"

parameters.name: minFee
parameters.description: The minimum amount for the fee, when amountType: percent. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 1.10

parameters.name: maxFee
parameters.description: The maximum amount for the fee, when amountType: percent. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 1.10

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

parameters.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

parameters.name: transaction_id

parameters.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

parameters.name: provider_transaction_id
parameters.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

parameters.name: system_timestamp
parameters.description: A system generated timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: provider_specified_id
parameters.description: Provider ID of the location, when locationType is 1.

parameters.name: min_fee
parameters.description: The minimum amount to charge, when amount_type is percent.

parameters.name: amount_type
parameters.description: The type of the amount: flat or percent.

parameters.name: max_fee
parameters.description: The minimum amount to charge, when amount_type is percent.

parameters.name: fee_type
parameters.description: Type of fee, FBD (FBE direct deposit fee) or DEL (ACH direct deposit fee).

status_codes.description: Location was not found
Fee has already been created
locationType 1 name is maximum of 15 characters
locationType 0 and 2 require location to be an integer value.

api_reference.title: Create Payment
api_reference.description: Use the Create Payment endpoint to move funds into a customer account. This endpoint may return load limit and velocity violations in its response. Payments created with this endpoint are returned by the Get Account Overview endpoint only after several seconds have elapsed. Load limit and velocity response If the payment violates load or velocity limits, this endpoint returns status: 26 with limit_error, limit_id, and limit_response_code values. Use the limit_id for troubleshooting the load and velocity configuration. The limit_response_code values are enumerated in the Limit Response Codes table. Consult the Creating a Payment guide for instructions on using this endpoint.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Currency amount as a whole or decimal amount. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The transaction type for the payment. Use the values provided by Galileo for your program. Pattern: 2-character alphanumeric Example: "RL"

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description for the transaction. If type is an otype that was custom-configured for your program, the description for that otype might override the description you provide here, depending on your setup with Galileo. Pattern: 1â€“40 alphanumeric characters, including punctuation Example: "One-time payroll load."

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Unique location identifier (location) as returned by the Create Location endpoint. This value is also returned by the Get Locations endpoint depending on the value of locationType when the location was created: 0 or 2 â€” Returned in the location_id field 1 â€” Returned in the provider_specified_id field Pattern: Integer if locationType: 0 or locationType: 2; max 15 characters if locationType: 1 Example: "a455-3483"

parameters.name: locationType
parameters.description: Type of ID in location: 0 â€” Galileo location ID 1 â€” Partner location ID 2 â€” Don't validate Pattern: Integer Example: 0

parameters.name: providerAssessedFee
parameters.description: Fee amount assessed by the provider. This value is passed to Galileo only for informational purposes; passing this value does not assess the fee. Pattern: Monetary amount greater than 0. Example: 2.50

parameters.name: verifyOnly
parameters.description: If a value of 1 is passed, the parameter data will be tested only. No transaction will be committed. Pattern: Integer Example: 0

parameters.name: merchantId
parameters.description: Identifier for the merchant that loaded the card. This parameter is used by load partners only. Pattern: Max 50 alphanumeric characters Example: "R12573L123"

parameters.name: partner
parameters.description: Partner providing the load request. This parameter is used by load partners only. Pattern: Max 50 alphanumeric characters Example: "CardLoader Inc"

parameters.name: retailChain
parameters.description: Name of the retail chain where the card was loaded. This parameter is used by load partners only. Pattern: Max 50 alphanumeric characters Example: "GroceryMart"

parameters.name: retailSaleTransactionKey
parameters.description: Identifier for the retail load transaction. This parameter is used by load partners only. Pattern: Max 50 alphanumeric characters Example: "12345abcdef"

parameters.name: storeAddress1
parameters.description: First line of the retail store address where the card was loaded. This parameter is used by load partners only. Pattern: 4â€“40 alphanumeric characters Example: 123 Elm St

parameters.name: storeAddress2
parameters.description: Second line of the retail store address where the card was loaded. This parameter is used by load partners only. Pattern: Max 30 alphanumeric characters Example: Ste 700

parameters.name: storeCounty
parameters.description: The country where the store is located. Three-digit UN M49 code, such as 840 for USA, 124 for Canada, 484 for Mexico, 170 for Colombia. Pattern: 3-digit number Example: 840

parameters.name: storeLatitude
parameters.description: Latitude for the retail store where the card was loaded. This parameter is used by load partners only. Pattern: Positive or negative float, no limit on decimal places Example: 40.57297941556069

parameters.name: storeLongitude
parameters.description: Longitude for the retail store where the card was loaded. This parameter is used by load partners only. Pattern: Positive or negative float, no limit on decimal places Example: -111.89920138637734

parameters.name: storeName
parameters.description: Name of the retail store where the card was loaded. This parameter is used by load partners only. Pattern: Max 50 alphanumeric characters Example: "Main Street GroceryMart"

parameters.name: storeNumber
parameters.description: Identifier for the retail store where the card was loaded. This parameter is used by load partners only. Pattern: Max 50 alphanumeric characters Example: "13459284"

parameters.name: storeTransactionDate
parameters.description: Date that the card was loaded. This parameter is used by load partners only. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: 2021-11-14 13:23:04

parameters.name: storeCity
parameters.description: City for the retail store where the card was loaded. This parameter is used by load partners only. Pattern: Max 30 letters and spaces Example: Salt Lake City

parameters.name: storeState
parameters.description: State for the retail store where the card was loaded. This parameter is used by load partners only. Pattern: 2-character state or province abbreviation Example: UT

parameters.name: storeZipCode
parameters.description: Zip code for the retail store where the card was loaded. This parameter is used by load partners only. Pattern: 12345, 12345-1234, or K1A-1A1 Example: "84121"

parameters.name: holdAmount
parameters.description: Amount to hold. To hold the entire payment amount, this value should be the same as amount. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: holdExpirationDateTime
parameters.description: Date-time to expire the hold. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: 2021-11-14 13:23:04

parameters.name: holdDescription
parameters.description: Description for the hold. Pattern: Max 80 alphanumeric characters, including punctuation Example: "One time payroll load."

parameters.name: holdExternalId
parameters.description: External identifier for a hold. Pattern: Max 60 alphanumeric characters Example: "45348bacd483348"

parameters.name: referenceId
parameters.description: Network identifier for RTP payments. Pattern: Max 35 alphanumeric characters Example: "20230805021000021P1BRJPM00040034610"

parameters.name: originatorName
parameters.description: Debtor (individual or company) name for RTP payments. Pattern: Max 140 characters Example: "John Doe"

parameters.name: receiverName
parameters.description: Creditor (individual or company) name for RTP payments. Pattern: Max 140 characters Example: "Jane Smith"

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code

parameters.name: rtoken

parameters.name: old_balance
parameters.description: The balance on the account before the transaction

parameters.name: new_balance
parameters.description: The balance on the account after the transaction

parameters.name: fee_amount
parameters.description: Payment fee amount. May return an integer if the fee amount is 0.

parameters.name: payment_trans_id
parameters.description: Galileo generated card payment or load transaction integer ID

parameters.name: hold_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the hold. Use the Expire Hold endpoint to expire the hold before the time in holdExpirationDateTime.

status_codes.description: Success -- partial limit violation. The value in amount exceeds the maximum account load and will only be partially applied. Inform the customer that the payment was only partially loaded to the account.
holdAmount is missing while holdExpirationDateTime is passed. When holdExpirationDateTime is populated, holdAmount is required.
Holds are not enabled for this product/program. Please contact client support for more information.
Provided XID does not map to a valid balance in our system. The internal account ID does not have a valid balance_id. Verify that the PRN is correct or contact Galileo for troubleshooting.
Provided expiration date needs to be in the correct format (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS) and needs to be in the future. Verify that holdExpirationDateTime is in the correct format and is in the future.
Amount must be equal to or less than the payment minus any other holds that have already been placed. The holdAmount is invalid.
An unknown error occurred while creating the hold. Please contact client support if this error persists.
Amount must be equal to or less than the account balance. The holdAmount cannot be a negative number or an amount larger than the account balance.

api_reference.title: Create Provisioning Request
api_reference.description: Use the Create Provisioning Request endpoint to push-provision a virtual card to a mobile wallet. This endpoint is part of a multiple-step integration that must be completed with each mobile wallet partner. Consult the Creating a Provisioning Request guide for instructions on using this endpoint.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN, PAN or CAD of the account. For card-specific endpoints such as this one, the CAD is preferred. Do not use the PRN if more than one card has ever been associated with this account. Pattern: PAN, PRN, or CAD Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: walletProvider
parameters.description: The type of wallet to provision: 1 â€” Apple Pay 2 â€” Google Pay 3 â€” Samsung Pay Pattern: One digit Example: 2

parameters.name: cert1
parameters.description: The leaf certificate returned by the wallet provider that was signed using cert2. Should be the hexlified (case insensitive) binary data of the certificate. See Certificate formatting for more information. Required for Apple Pay; not required for Samsung Pay or Google Pay.

parameters.name: cert2
parameters.description: The subordinate certificate returned by the wallet provider that was signed using the wallet providerâ€™s Certificate Authority (CA) certificate. Should be the hexlified (case insensitive) binary data of the certificate. See Certificate formatting for more information. Required for Apple Pay; not required for Samsung Pay or Google Pay.

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: The hexlified (case insensitive) nonce value returned by Apple Pay. Required for Apple Pay; not required for Google Pay or Samsung Pay. Pattern: 8 character nonce value Example: "9c023092"

parameters.name: nonceSignature
parameters.description: The hexlified (case insensitive) nonce signature value returned by Apple Pay. Required for Apple Pay; not required for Google Pay or Samsung Pay. Pattern: Nonce signature value Example: "4082f883ae62..."

parameters.name: clientWalletAccountID
parameters.description: Value returned by Google Pay or Samsung Pay for use with Visa. Required for Visa + Samsung Pay or Google Pay; not required for Visa + Apple Pay.

parameters.name: clientDeviceID
parameters.description: Value returned by Google Pay or Samsung Pay for use with Visa. Required for Visa + Samsung Pay or Google Pay; not required for Visa + Apple Pay.

parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

status_codes.description: Certificate chain validation failed. Verify that the certificate has not expired and that it is valid.
Virtual Product ID not specified. Verify that PPUPC is set to Y for the product.
Bad XID. Verify that the correct value is in accountNo.
Error creating new PRN. Legacy setups only. Contact Galileo for troubleshooting.
Account creation error. Legacy setups only. Contact Galileo for troubleshooting.

Association not implemented. The card in accountNo belongs to a card network that Galileo does not support for mobile wallets. Verify that the PAN belongs to a card network that Galileo supports for mobile wallets.

Apple encryption failure. There was an issue with the shared library or key generation. Verify that you are using the correct libraries or that the key was properly generated. Verify that the setting for PPALE is correct for legacy setups.
Error getting provisioning data. There was a database connection issue, or an exception occurred while getting payment or activation data.
Wallet provider not implemented. Verify that the integration work for the provider specified in walletProvider has been done. Contact Galileo for more information.
Wallet provider not recognized. Verify that the value for walletProvider is 1, 2, or 3.
VISA request data missing or incomplete. Samsung Pay and Google Pay only. Verify that the Visa request data is present and that it contains all required attributes.
Active physical card to tokenize not found. Verify that the card account in accountNo is a physical card that is in status: N.
