api_reference.title: Create Simulated Card Authorization
api_reference.description: Use the Create Simulated Card Authorization endpoint to simulate a card authorization in the CV environment. This endpoint creates but does not settle a card authorization for the account and returns a response code and its description with the auth_id. Capture the auth_id to settle the transaction with Create Simulated Card Settlement. For instructions on using this endpoint see Simulating Card Transactions. ðŸš§WarningDo not use this endpoint in Production.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount of the transaction in the currency at the point of sale. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: association
parameters.description: Specifies which card network to simulate: visa (Visa), star (STAR), mc_auth (Mastercard), coop (Co-op), or visa_baseii (Visa Base II). Pattern: visa, mc_auth, visa_baseii, star, coopExample:"visa"`

parameters.name: merchantName
parameters.description: Simulated merchant name. Pass 40 characters for the complete string or pass up to 22 characters and the simulator will add 18 characters of a simulated address. For settlements, this parameter is required when authId is not populated. Pattern: Max 40 alphanumeric characters Example: "Fred Jones Bagels"

parameters.name: acquirerId
parameters.description: Simulated acquirer ID. If this value is not passed, the simulator inserts a random 6-digit number. Pattern: 6-digit number Example: 437723

parameters.name: terminalId
parameters.description: Simulated terminal ID. If this value is not passed, the simulator inserts a random 8-digit number. Pattern: 8-digit number Example: 57395783

parameters.name: merchantId
parameters.description: Simulated merchant ID. If this value is not passed, the simulator inserts a random 15-character alphanumeric string. Pattern: Max 15 alphanumeric characters Example: "asdf45sdf6sd3d0a"

parameters.name: currencyCode
parameters.description: The currency code for amount. Use ISO 4217 numeric currency codes. This parameter is required when using this endpoint outside the United States. Pattern: 3 digits Example: "840"

parameters.name: settleAmount
parameters.description: The amount to be transferred from merchant to issuer in the settlement currency. Required when specialFunctions: make_multicurrency Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: settleCurrencyCode
parameters.description: The currency code for settleAmount. Use ISO 4217 numeric currency codes. Required when specialFunctions: make_multicurrency. Pattern: 3 digits Example: "124"

parameters.name: cardBillingAmount
parameters.description: The amount that will be posted to the cardholder account in the currency of the account. Required when specialFunctions: make_multicurrency. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: cardBillingCurrencyCode
parameters.description: The currency code for cardBillingAmount. Use ISO 4217 numeric currency codes. Required when specialFunctions: make_multicurrency. Pattern: 3 digits Example: 484

parameters.name: mcc
parameters.description: ISO 18245 merchant category code. Pattern: 4 digits Example: 3408

parameters.name: originalAuthId
parameters.description: The auth_id of the previous authorization in a series, such as with a completion, reversal or incremental authorization. Required when transType is 3, 4, 5 or 6 (Visa) or 3 (Mastercard) or 4, 5, 6 (Star). Pattern: Numerals Example: 30582

parameters.name: specialFunctions
parameters.description: Additional function to add to the simulated transaction. See the Special Functions enumeration for valid values. Pattern: Max 100 characters Example "add_cashback"

parameters.name: posEntryMode
parameters.description: The first two characters of DE022. Specifies how the PAN was entered, such as magnetic stripe, EMV chip or contactless. See DE022 Codes for possible values. Valid only when association: visa. Pattern: 2 characters Example: 01

parameters.name: requesterId
parameters.description: An identifier for the entity that makes a tokenization request. Required when specialFunctions: make_tokenized. Pattern: Numerals Example: 3030303

parameters.name: walletId
parameters.description: Identifier for the mobile wallet that contains the card that was used for the transaction. Required when association: mc_auth and specialFunctions: make_tokenized. Pattern: Numerals Example: 474747474

parameters.name: latitudeAndLongitude
parameters.description: The latitude and longitude of the point of sale. Valid only when association: visa and transType: 17. Default: 40.76078/-111.89105 (Salt Lake City, UT) Pattern: 99.99999/-99.99999 Example: "40.76078/-111.89105"

parameters.name: partialAmount
parameters.description: Amount of a partial authorization. Valid only when association: mc_auth and specialFunctions: make_partial_reversal. Pattern: Integer or decimal amount Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: partialForeignAmount
parameters.description: Amount of a partial authorization when the point of sale is a different country than the account. Valid only when association: mc_auth and specialFunctions: make_partial_reversal. Pattern: Integer or decimal amount Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: cashbackAmount
parameters.description: Amount in localAmt that is provided in cash. Valid only when association: mc_auth and specialFunctions: make_cashback. Debit accounts only. Pattern: Integer or decimal amount Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: cashAdvanceAmount
parameters.description: Amount in localAmt that is provided in cash. Valid only when association: mc_auth and specialFunctions: make_cashback. Credit accounts only. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: pin
parameters.description: To include the PIN that is already set for the card, leave this value blank and pass specialFunctions: add_pin (Visa) or specialFunctions: make_debit (Mastercard). Pass a value for this parameter to use that value in the request and also to change the PIN for the card. Pattern: 4 digits Example: 4395

parameters.name: transType
parameters.description: The type of transaction to simulate. See the Simulated Transaction Types enumeration for valid values. Pattern: 1 or 2 digits Example: 3

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

parameters.name: processing_time
parameters.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

parameters.name: provider_timestamp
parameters.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

parameters.name: provider_transaction_id
parameters.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

parameters.name: system_timestamp
parameters.description: A system generated timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: auth_response_code
parameters.description: A code used to give the status of the simulated auth

parameters.name: auth_response_description
parameters.description: A description of the authorization response

parameters.name: auth_id
parameters.description: An ID associated with the simulated auth

status_codes.description: Method not available in the production environment

api_reference.title: Create Simulated Card Settlement
api_reference.description: Use the Create Simulated Card Settlement endpoint to settle a simulated card authorization in the CV environment. First, create a simulated authorization using the Create Simulated Card Authorization endpoint, and then use this endpoint to settle it. If authId is not populated, then merchantName is required. Populate merchantName but not authId to simulate a force-posted transaction. For instructions on using this endpoint see Simulating Card Transactions. ðŸš§WarningDo not use this endpoint in Production.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount of the transaction in the currency at the point of sale. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: association
parameters.description: Specifies which card network to simulate: visa (Visa), star (STAR), mc_auth (Mastercard), coop (Co-op), or visa_baseii (Visa Base II). Pattern: visa, mc_auth, visa_baseii, star, coopExample:"visa"`

parameters.name: merchantName
parameters.description: Simulated merchant name. Pass 40 characters for the complete string or pass up to 22 characters and the simulator will add 18 characters of a simulated address. For settlements, this parameter is required when authId is not populated. Pattern: Max 40 alphanumeric characters Example: "Fred Jones Bagels"

parameters.name: currencyCode
parameters.description: The currency code for amount. Use ISO 4217 numeric currency codes. This parameter is required when using this endpoint outside the United States. Pattern: 3 digits Example: "840"

parameters.name: settleAmount
parameters.description: The amount to be transferred from merchant to issuer in the settlement currency. Required when specialFunctions: make_multicurrency Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: settleCurrencyCode
parameters.description: The currency code for settleAmount. Use ISO 4217 numeric currency codes. Required when specialFunctions: make_multicurrency. Pattern: 3 digits Example: "124"

parameters.name: cardBillingAmount
parameters.description: The amount that will be posted to the cardholder account in the currency of the account. Required when specialFunctions: make_multicurrency. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: cardBillingCurrencyCode
parameters.description: The currency code for cardBillingAmount. Use ISO 4217 numeric currency codes. Required when specialFunctions: make_multicurrency. Pattern: 3 digits Example: 484

parameters.name: authId
parameters.description: The authorization ID (auth_id) as returned by the Create Simulated Card Authorization endpoint. If this parameter is not populated then merchantName is required. Pattern: Positive integer Example: 58344373

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.name: status

parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: settle_response_code
parameters.description: A code used to give the status of the simulated auth settlement

parameters.name: settle_response_description

api_reference.title: Create Single-Use Virtual Card
api_reference.description: Use the Create Single-Use Virtual Card endpoint to create a single-use virtual card for a BNPL customer. To use this endpoint with a product, the SUVC product parameter must be set to Y, indicating that the product is a single-use virtual card.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: primaryAccountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of an existing account held by the customer receiving the single use virtual card Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: prodId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued unique product identifier Pattern: Max 9 digits Example: 501

parameters.name: creditLimit
parameters.description: Credit limit for the single-use virtual card. Minimum value is 50.00. Pattern: Decimal number (14, 2) Example: 500.25

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

parameters.name: rtoken

parameters.name: pmt_ref_no
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the new account.

parameters.name: card_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the card associated with the account.

status_codes.description: The product that corresponds with the prodId does not support single-use virtual cards. Occurs when SUVC is not set to Y.
Error creating the new account for the SUVC card
setCreditLimit error

api_reference.title: Create Virtual Card Account
api_reference.description: Use the Create Virtual Card Account endpoint to create a virtual card account for a new customer. To create any other type of account for a new customer use the Create Account endpoint. Create Virtual Account is similar to Create Account except that it accepts only virtual card product IDs for prodId. Consult the Creating an Account procedure for instructions on using this endpoint, and consult the Customer ID Verification guide for how to use this endpoint with Galileo's integrated CIP solution. ðŸ“˜NoteYou must be PCI-compliant to use this endpoint. If you are not PCI compliant, use the Create Account endpoint and specify a virtual card product for prodId. ðŸ“˜NoteIf this endpoint returns a status code that does not match a status code that is specific to this endpoint, it may be an enrollment status code. See Enrollment Statuses for more information.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: prodId
parameters.description: Galileo-generated identifier for a product. If this ID is for a business product then businessName is required. Pattern: Integer Example: 501

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The value of the primary identifier that is specified in idType. Product settings determine whether this ID should be unique across the program or product. This parameter is required when using Galileo's integrated CIP solution. Galileo converts all letters to lowercase. Pattern: As specified in the Layout column of the Customer ID Types enumeration Example: "123456789"

parameters.name: idType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of primary identifier in the id parameter. This parameter is required when id is populated. See the ID column in the Customer ID Types table for valid values. Pattern: 1- or 2-digit integer Example: 2

parameters.name: id2
parameters.description: The value of the secondary identifier that is specified in idType2. Galileo converts all letters to lowercase. Pattern: As specified in the Layout column of the Customer ID Types enumeration Example: "123456789012|ut|12/25/2020"

parameters.name: idType2
parameters.description: Specifies the type of secondary identifier in the id2 parameter. This parameter is required when id2 is populated. See the ID column in the Customer ID Types table for valid values. Pattern: 1- or 2-digit integer Example: 1

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The account holder language and localization preference. Default is en_US. Valid values are en_US, es_US, fr_CA, en_CA, es_MX, en_MX. If the account holder address is outside the U.S., pass a non _US value for this parameter to disable U.S. address validation. Pattern: Letters with underscore Example: "en_US"

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Account holder's first name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "Ed"

parameters.name: middleName
parameters.description: Account holder's middle name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "W"

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Account holder's last name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "Harley"

parameters.name: dateOfBirth
parameters.description: Account holder's birth date. This date is compared with the DOB product parameter when there is a minimum age requirement on the account. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD Example: "1980-01-01"

parameters.name: address1
parameters.description: Account holder's first address line. Cannot be a P.O. box. Validation rules for address1. Pattern: 4â€“40 alphanumeric characters Example: "33 Maple Street"

parameters.name: address2
parameters.description: Account holder's second address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 40 characters Example: "#4B"

parameters.name: address3
parameters.description: Account holder's third address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: "Carrera Central"

parameters.name: address4
parameters.description: Account holder's fourth address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: "Barrio El Alhambra"

parameters.name: address5
parameters.description: Account holder's fifth address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: "Piso 3"

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Account holder's city. Pattern: Max 30 characters: letters, spaces, hyphen and period Example: "Salt Lake City"

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Account holder's state or province. Pattern: 2,3-character state or province abbreviation Example: "UT"

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Account holder's postal code (ZIP code). Pattern: 12345, 12345-1234, or K1A-1A1 Example: "84121"

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Account holder's country. Three-digit UN M49 code, such as 840 for USA, 124 for Canada, 484 for Mexico, 170 for Colombia. Pattern: 3-digit number Example: "840"

parameters.name: primaryPhone
parameters.description: Account holder's primary phone number. Pattern: Validation according to the value in mobilePhoneCountryCode. Example: "8013656060"

parameters.name: otherPhone
parameters.description: Account holder's secondary phone number. Pattern: Validation according to the value in mobilePhoneCountryCode. Example: "8013656060"

parameters.name: mobilePhone
parameters.description: Account holder's mobile phone number. Pattern: Validation according to the value in mobilePhoneCountryCode. Example: "8013656060"

parameters.name: mobileCarrierId
parameters.description: Account holder's mobile carrier. Configurable list. Pattern: Configurable list Example: "8"

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Account holder's email. The Python implementation uses Marshmallow validation for this field. For the PHP implementation, contact Galileo. Pattern: Email address, 3â€“63 characters Example: "user@fakedomain.com"

parameters.name: webUid
parameters.description: Account holder's username for the Galileo-hosted website. Must be unique across the program. Pattern: Alphanumeric, with first character a letter; case insensitive Example: "eharley"

parameters.name: webPwd
parameters.description: Account holder's password for the Galileo-hosted website. Pattern: Min 8 characters: must include upper-case character, lower-case character, and a number Example: "4j9KH3kkdh"

parameters.name: secretQuestion
parameters.description: Account holder's secret question for the Galileo-hosted website. Pattern: Max 50 characters: letters, spaces, ? Example: "What was the name of your first pet?"

parameters.name: secretAnswer
parameters.description: Account holder's answer to secretQuestion. Pattern: Max 50 characters: letters, spaces, ? Example: "Larry"

parameters.name: loadAmount
parameters.description: Currency amount passed as a whole or decimal amount. Initial load amount on a card must be within product load limits or be the designated amount for an instant-issue card. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100 or 100.73

parameters.name: loadType
parameters.description: Transaction type for the loadAmount. Use values from your Galileo-supplied list of load types. If no loadType is specified, the default type RL is used. Pattern: 2 characters Example: "RL"

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: Identifier supplied by the provider, which is not related to the Galileo system. This ID is stored in the Galileo system in association with this account and can be provided in the RDFs. Pattern: Max 30 alphanumeric characters. Lowercase only. Example: "553b45sbs"

parameters.name: primaryAccount
parameters.description: PAN or PRN of the primary account to associate this account with. Populate this parameter only when creating a secondary account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "123456789012"

parameters.name: sharedBalance
parameters.description: Specifies whether the secondary account will share the balance of the primary account. This parameter is required when primaryAccount is populated. Do not set this parameter to 1 when primaryAccount is not populated. 0 â€” Do not share the balance 1 â€” Share the balance Pattern: One digit Example: 1

parameters.name: userData
parameters.description: Data supplied by the provider, from sources external to the Galileo system. This data will be stored in the Galileo system in association with this account. The most common use of this parameter is to track affiliate-marketing traffic. The data in this field can be added to an RDF. Pattern: Max 50 alphanumeric characters and spaces Example: "a4434gg44"

parameters.name: verifyOnly
parameters.description: Pass 1 to test the validity of the parameter data without committing the information to the Galileo system. Pattern: 0 or 1 Example: 1

parameters.name: loadFromAccountNo
parameters.description: To load funds into the account at the time of account creation, specify the PAN or PRN of the source account for the funds. This account must be in the same program as the account being created. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: sweepDate
parameters.description: The last date that a daily sweep should be performed. This parameter is valid only if account sweeping is configured for the product. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD Example: "2016-01-01"

parameters.name: creditLimit
parameters.description: Credit limit for card based spending control (currently only available for credit processing). Pattern: Monetary amount greater than 0. Example: 500.25

parameters.name: singleUse
parameters.description: Spending control parameter that flags card for one purchasing transaction (currently only available for credit processing). Pattern: Y or N Example: "Y"

parameters.name: businessName
parameters.description: Account holder's business name. This field is required if prodId is a business product. Pattern: 2-150 characters. See the supported character set. Example: "Ed%26Ted"

parameters.name: mobilePhoneCountryCode
parameters.description: Account holder's mobile phone country code. Pattern: A plus sign followed by 1â€“3 digits. See Phone Validation for valid values. Example: "+1"

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

parameters.name: processing_time
parameters.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

parameters.name: provider_timestamp
parameters.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

parameters.name: provider_transaction_id
parameters.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

parameters.name: system_timestamp
parameters.description: A system generated timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: pmt_ref_no
parameters.description: Galileo-generated account number. Also called the PRN.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the product associated with the account

parameters.name: galileo_account_number
parameters.description: Galileo-generated balance ID

parameters.name: card_id
parameters.description: Galileo-generated card identifier (CAD). Use this ID instead of the PAN if not PCI-compliant. None means that no card was created

parameters.name: card_number
parameters.description: The primary account number (PAN) printed on the card

parameters.name: expiry_date
parameters.description: Date when the card expires

parameters.name: card_security_code
parameters.description: The card verification value (CVV2)

parameters.name: model_name
parameters.description: The model name

parameters.name: model_version
parameters.description: Version number for the model used

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: In a model run, lists the pass number

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Plain text description of the code value

parameters.name: date_time
parameters.description: The date and time CIP was run

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: Account holder's first name

parameters.name: middle_name
parameters.description: Account holder's middle name

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description: Account holder's last name

parameters.name: address_1
parameters.description: First line of the account holder's address

parameters.name: address_2
parameters.description: Second line of the account holder's address

parameters.name: primary_phone
parameters.description: Account holder's primary phone number

parameters.name: other_phone
parameters.description: Account holder's other phone number

parameters.name: billing_cycle_day
parameters.description: The day of the month the billing cycle starts for the account

status_codes.description: Load amount outside of load limits. Retry with loadAmount within load limits for this prod_id.
Could not create enrollment. Failed to create the customer record. Contact Galileo for troublshooting.
Could not load card. Card load failed. Contact Galileo for troubleshooting

Account created, ID Validation failed. Customer's personal info has failed the ID check. Take action depending on the result in the response: F â€” Fail. Take no action: the customer does not qualify for an account.R â€” Refer. Depending on your arrangements with Galileo, request valid documents from the customer or wait for Galileo's third-party CIP to complete.
Specified load from account number is invalid. The funding account to load this prod_id is not properly set up.
A load was attempted for a non-positive amount. Retry with a positive value for loadAmount.
Primary account is invalid. Retry with a valid number for primaryAccount.
Secondary accounts cannot be added. Product parameters do not permit the prodId to be a secondary account for the account in primaryAccount. Check SECP on the primary account.
Maximum number of secondary accounts exceeded. To increase the secondary account limit per product ID, set SECLM on the secondary account.
ID type 2 is required as main ID for running CIP. Product settings require idType: 2 (SSN/SIN) to run Galileo's integrated customer ID verification. Pass a SSN in id. Controlled by VLDLV.
An application with the same ID has already been submitted. Duplicate SSNs were used for enrollment. Follow your business plan for this outcome. Controlled by VLDLV.
Success - partial limit violation. Only the amount permitted by project settings was loaded.
Success - delayed payment. The account was created but funds were not loaded onto the card because of limit violations. An attempt will be made tomorrow to load the card.

api_reference.title: Delete Account-Level Auth Control
api_reference.description: Use the Delete Account-Level Auth Control endpoint to delete one velocity ALC. To delete a velocity control with MCCs, you must specify the full range in beginningMcc and endMcc.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN for the account. Do not use the CAD or PAN. Pattern: 12-digit numeric string Example: "344101254935"

parameters.name: controlId
parameters.description: The control ID of the velocity control to delete, as returned by Get Auth Control. Pattern: Integer, max 18 digits Example: 10492

parameters.name: beginningMcc
parameters.description: The start of the MCC range for the control to delete. Pattern: 3â€“4 digit integer, no leading zero Example: 3000

parameters.name: endMcc
parameters.description: The end of the MCC range for the control to delete. Pattern: 3â€“4 digit integer, no leading zero Example: 3999

parameters.name: response-content-type

parameters.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

parameters.name: provider_transaction_id
parameters.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

parameters.name: system_timestamp
parameters.description: A system generated timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

status_codes.description: Auth control not found. A velocity control with that controlId does not exist. Verify that the ID is correct by calling Get Auth Control.
No Account MCC auth limit found to be deleted

api_reference.title: Delete Account-Level MCC Control
api_reference.description: Use the Delete Account-Level MCC Control endpoint to delete one MCC ALC. You must specify the entire MCC range for the control in mccControlStart and mccControlEnd.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey

api_reference.title: Force Pass CIP

This endpoint is valid only if you are using Galileo's CIP and you verify customer documents when the customer fails CIP. api_reference.title: Get Access Token
api_reference.description: Use the Get Access Token endpoint to retrieve an access token for a card, account, or customer record. The expiry in seconds (default: 300) and usage count (default: 3) for the access token are configurable using the TSECV (seconds) and TUSEC (usage) parameters. When type: 0 always use CAD for accountNo. Use this endpoint to send a customer a link to a one-time view of a dynamically generated image of a virtual card via HTTP, for example, or for other purposes as appropriate. Consult Digital card images in the Retrieving Card Information guide for more information. For other uses contact Galileo.

api_reference.title: Get Account Overview
api_reference.description: Use the Get Account Overview endpoint to retrieve the combined response data from several other endpoints. Best practice is to use this endpoint to retrieve the data for a customer's landing page or other similar display. Data sets returned by Get Account Overview: General account information (balance, status, application date) Cardholder profile data Posted transactions Pending card authorizations Pending fees (generally because of insufficient funds) Savings interest data, applicable only if an associated savings account exists; otherwise, a unary savings_interest element is returned. ðŸ“˜NoteTransactions created by Program API endpoints (such as Create Payment, Create Adjustment, and Create Account Transfer) are not present in this endpoint's response for several seconds after creation.

parameters.name: network_id
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated code to identify the subnetwork over which the transaction took place. Maps to network_code.

parameters.name: local_amt
parameters.description: Amount of the authorization request at the point of sale. Unsigned. This amount does not include upcharges or program fees. In the authorizations object, this amount is displayed in cents. (DE004)

parameters.description: Currency code for local_amt (DE049)

parameters.name: billing_amt

parameters.name: billing_curr_code
parameters.description: Currency code for billing_amt (DE051)

parameters.name: credit_ind

api_reference.title: Get ACH Accounts
api_reference.description: Use the Get ACH Accounts endpoint to retrieve a record of ACH accounts that are linked to a customer account. For instructions on using this endpoint see Viewing ACH accounts in the ACH Endpoints guide. ðŸ‘WarningIf you plan to display ACH account and routing numbers to customers, be aware that the accountNo and routingNo returned by this endpoint may be tokenized if an aggregator service (such as Plaid) is used. Only display these values to customers if you are sure they will not be tokenized.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

parameters.name: processing_time
parameters.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

parameters.name: provider_timestamp
parameters.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

parameters.name: provider_transaction_id
parameters.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

parameters.name: system_timestamp
parameters.description: A system generated timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: found
parameters.description: The number of ACH accounts found

parameters.name: ach_account_id
parameters.description: A unique ID for an ACH account

parameters.name: routing_no
parameters.description: A number used to associate a transaction with an institution

parameters.name: account_no
parameters.description: A number use to associate a transaction with an account

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of record being displayed

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the ACH account being displayed

parameters.name: company_name
parameters.description: Name of the company that owns the ACH account. Returned when entity_type: C.

parameters.name: entity_type
parameters.description: Type of account holder of the ACH account: individual (I) or company (C).

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: First name of the ACH account holder. Returned when entity_type: I.

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description: Last name of the ACH account holder. Returned when entity_type: I

parameters.name: file_first_name
parameters.description: First name of the individual account holder that is used in the outgoing Nacha file. Returned when entity_type: I

parameters.name: file_last_name
parameters.description: Last name of the individual account holder that is used in the outgoing Nacha file. Returned when entity_type: I

api_reference.title: Get ACH Transaction History
api_reference.description: Use the Get ACH Transaction History endpoint to retrieve the ACH transaction history for the specified customer account. This endpoint retrieves outgoing ACH transactions only.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for the date range, either a date or a date-time. Must be equal to or later than startDate. Max 1098 days (~3 years) after startDate. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2016-01-01"

parameters.description: A unique ID for an ACH transaction

api_reference.title: Get All Transaction History
api_reference.description: Use the Get All Transaction History endpoint to retrieve all of the transactions on the Galileo ledger, including backouts, denied transactions, AVS-only requests, and tokenization requests. This endpoint returns the same transactions as the All Transactions page in the CST. See Record-Set Pagination for instructions on using the paging parameters. Open the Recipes below to see response examples. ðŸš§CautionDo not use the calculated_balance value in the response. The method for providing the value in calculated_balance is not reliable enough to be considered authoritative. The beginning_balance field is likewise unreliable.Instead, use the ROLLING BALANCE field in the Posted Transactions RDF to see the available balance after each transaction.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey

parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The Galileo system date/time when a transaction posted to the customer account, in Mountain Standard Time (-0700).

parameters.description: The transaction amount in the currency of the account. A negative amount debits funds from the customer account.

Refer to transaction types for card-transaction values; for other transaction types, consult the otype list that Galileo gave you.

parameters.description: Currency code for billing_amt (DE051).

parameters.name: pmt_ref_no
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated number to identify the customer account. Maps to PRN and prn.

parameters.name: mcc_code

parameters.name: credit_ind
parameters.description: Indicates whether a PIN was input at the point of sale. Y = No PIN was input. N = A PIN was input. None = Not a card transaction, or not processed as a card transaction.

parameters.name: iac_tax
parameters.description: Impuesto al consumo. Colombian consumption tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

parameters.name: iva_tax
parameters.description: Impuesto al valor agregado. Colombian value-added tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

api_reference.title: Get Auth Control
api_reference.description: Use the Get Auth Control endpoint to retrieve the velocity control details and their control IDsâ€”at either the product level or account level, with or without MCC ranges. See Retrieving velocity limits for instructions on using this endpoint.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN for the account. Do not use the CAD or PAN. Pass this value to retrieve all of the account-level velocity controls for this account. If this parameter is not populated then prodId must be populated. Pattern: PRN (12-digit numeric string) Example: "344101254935"

parameters.name: controlId
parameters.description: The Galileo-generated identifier for the auth-level velocity control. When this parameter is populated then either prodId or accountNo must also be populated. Pattern: Integer, max 18 digits Example: 102

parameters.name: prodId
parameters.description: The Galileo-generated identifier for the product. Pass this value to retrieve all of the product-level velocity controls for this product. If this parameter is not populated then accountNo must be populated. Pattern: Integer Example: 15293

parameters.name: beginningMcc
parameters.description: The start of the MCC range for the control. If this parameter is populated, then endMcc and accountNo must be populated. Pattern: 3â€“4 digit integer, no leading zero Example: 3000

parameters.name: endMcc
parameters.description: The end of the MCC range for the control. If this parameter is populated, then beginningMcc and accountNo must be populated. Pattern: 3â€“4 digit integer, no leading zero Example: 3999

parameters.description: Description of the velocity control.

parameters.name: control_id

parameters.name: beginning_mcc
parameters.description: The initial MCC value for the range of this control. This field is present only when MCCs are specified for the control.

parameters.name: end_mcc
parameters.description: The final MCC value for the range of this control. This field is present only when MCCs are specified for the control.

parameters.name: domestic_flag
parameters.description: Whether this velocity control applies to domestic transactions, international transactions or both. Yâ€”Domestic only; Nâ€”International only; Aâ€”Both

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Starting date-time of the account-level velocity control. Not populated for product-level controls.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Ending date-time of the account-level velocity control. Not populated for product-level controls.

parameters.name: has_pin
parameters.description: Whether the limit applies to PIN transactions, signature transactions or both. Yâ€”PIN only; Nâ€”Signature only; Aâ€”Both

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Timespan for the velocity control. xD (x days), xM (x months), 1T (one transaction).

parameters.name: trans_type
parameters.description: Type of transaction affected by the control: ATM, CAD, CBA, POS, VFT.

parameters.name: transaction_count_used

api_reference.title: Get Authorization History
api_reference.description: Use the Get Authorization History endpoint to retrieve a list of authorizations that have not settled, expired, or been reversed. See Record-Set Pagination for instructions on using the paging parameters. Open the Recipe below to see a response example.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The beginning date for the date range, either a date or a date-time. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2016-01-01"

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for the date range, either a date or a date-time. Must be equal to or later than startDate. Max 1098 days (~3 years) after startDate. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2016-01-01"

parameters.name: recordCnt
parameters.description: The maximum number of records per page to be returned. Pattern: Positive integer 1-99999 Example: 100

parameters.name: includeRelated
parameters.description: Whether to return data for related accounts. See Getting related account information for instructions on using this parameter. Default is 1. Pattern: 0 or 1 Example: 0

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

parameters.name: processing_time
parameters.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

parameters.name: provider_timestamp
parameters.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

parameters.name: provider_transaction_id
parameters.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

parameters.name: system_timestamp
parameters.description: A system generated timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: auth_id
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated identifier for an authorization.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Description provided by the merchant about the transaction (DE043)

parameters.name: details_formatted
parameters.description: The same information as in the details field, with formatting

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The authorization amount, in the currency of the account

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: The Galileo system timestamp for the authorization, in Mountain Standard Time (-0700)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Reference your program's authorization transaction types for possible values.

parameters.name: mcc
parameters.description: Category code for the merchant that initiated the transaction (DE018)

parameters.name: merchant_id
parameters.description: Network-assigned identifier for a merchant (DE042)

parameters.name: acq_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the acquirer (DE032)

parameters.name: terminal_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the card reader at the point of sale (DE041)

parameters.name: can_be_expired
parameters.description: Whether to allow an expiration on this authorization: 1 = Allow, or 0 = Do not allow

parameters.name: original_auth_id
parameters.description: The auth_id of the previous transaction in the sequence, if any. Maps to prior_id in other contexts.

parameters.name: network_code
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated code to identify the network over which the transaction took place. Maps to network_id.

parameters.name: local_amt
parameters.description: Amount in cents of the transaction based on the currency at the point of sale (DE004). 12-digit number including leading zeros.

parameters.name: local_curr_code
parameters.description: Currency code for local_amt (DE049)

parameters.name: settle_amt
parameters.description: The transaction amount, in cents, in the settlement currency (DE005). 12-digit number including leading zeros.

parameters.name: settle_curr_code
parameters.description: Currency code for settle_amt (DE050)

parameters.name: billing_amt
parameters.description: The billing amount in cents (DE006). 12-digit number including leading zeros.

parameters.name: billing_curr_code
parameters.description: Currency code for billing_amt (DE051)

parameters.name: iac_tax
parameters.description: Impuesto al Consumo. Colombian consumption tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

parameters.name: iva_tax
parameters.description: Impuesto al Valor Agregado. Colombian value-added tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

parameters.name: latest_incremental_id
parameters.description: The auth_id of the previous authorization in an incremental sequence, if any. This field contains the same information as original_auth_id and is present only by request.

parameters.name: original_incremental_id
parameters.description: The auth_id of the first authorization in an incremental sequence, if any. This field is present only by request.

api_reference.title: Get Balance
api_reference.description: Use the Get Balance endpoint to retrieve the specified account balance and its currency code. This endpoint returns the balance for all accounts that share the same balance ID (Galileo account number).

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey

parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.description: A system generated timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: balance
parameters.description: For debit accounts, this is the available balance to spend, meaning the total of all posted transactions with all pending transactions subtracted out. For credit accounts this is the unpaid balance.

parameters.name: balance_without_pending
parameters.description: For debit accounts, the total of all posted transactions with only pending authorizations subtracted out. For credit accounts this is the same as balance.

parameters.name: currency_code
parameters.description: A three-digit ISO 4217 code for the currency of the account. All amounts in this response are in this currency.

parameters.name: pending_adjustments
parameters.description: Total of all adjustments created by a batch process. This value will almost always be 0.

parameters.name: pending_billpay
parameters.description: The total amount of pending bill payments. A bill payment is pending between the time it is created and when the amount is adjusted out of the account.

parameters.name: pending_purchase
parameters.description: Amounts from a deprecated feature. This value will always be 0.

parameters.name: balance_without_auths
parameters.description: The balance without subtracting out authorization holds. This field is populated only when the BWOOA parameter is set.

api_reference.title: Get Card Tokens
api_reference.description: Use the Get Card Tokens endpoint to retrieve information on tokens associated with a card. To use this endpoint, the MTLCM product parameter must be set. This endpoint is currently valid only for Mastercard.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN, PAN or CAD of the account. For card-specific endpoints such as this one, the CAD is preferred. Do not use the PRN if more than one card has ever been associated with this account. Pattern: PAN, PRN, or CAD Example: "999103447228"

parameters.name: tokenUniqueReference
parameters.description: A unique 48-character reference assigned to a token and used to identify the token for the duration of its lifetime. Pattern: 48-char alphanumeric Example: "DWSPMC00000000010906a349d9ca4eb1a4d53e3c90a11d9c"

parameters.name: includeDeviceTokensOnly
parameters.description: Specifies whether to receive only the tokens tied to the cardholder device: true â€” MDES returns only the device-based tokens false â€” MDES returns all tokens mapped to the PAN (server, device, and COF). Pattern: Boolean Example: true

parameters.name: excludeDeletedIndicator
parameters.description: Specifies whether to exclude deleted tokens from the search results. Valid values: true â€” Exclude deleted tokens from the search results. false â€” Include deleted tokens in the search results. Pattern: true or false Example: true

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: token_unique_reference
parameters.description: Unique reference assigned to a token, used to identify the token for the duration of its lifetime.

parameters.name: expiration_date
parameters.description: Expiration date of the token. Conditional field, present once the token has been designated for the digitization. Format: MMYY.

parameters.name: current_status_code
parameters.description: Current status of the token. See current_status_description field for the value descriptions: U, A, S, D.

parameters.name: current_status_description
parameters.description: Description for the current_status_code: "Unmapped", "Active", "Suspended", "Deleted"

parameters.name: current_status_date_time
parameters.description: Date-time the status was updated. ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD.

parameters.name: token_requestor_id
parameters.description: The entity uniquely recognized by Mastercard as the Token Requestor

parameters.name: token_requestor_name
parameters.description: The legal name of the token requestor. There can be more than one Token Requestor ID per token Requester Name (legal name), so you should use both the ID and the name to uniquely identify a token requestor.

parameters.name: token_type
parameters.description: Type of token. Valid values: S (embedded secure element token), C (Mastercard cloud-based payments token), F (COF token)

parameters.name: wallet_id
parameters.description: Identifier of the wallet provider that requested the tokenization of the card.

parameters.name: tokenRequestorId
parameters.description: Unique ID assigned to the initiator of the token request.

parameters.name: tokenReferenceId
parameters.description: Unique ID for the token associated with the PAN.

parameters.name: entityOfLastAction
parameters.description: The entity that performed the last action. TOKEN_REQUESTOR ISSUER

parameters.name: tokenType
parameters.description: Type of token. SECURE_ELEMENT HCE CARD_ON_FILE ECOMMERCE QRC

parameters.name: tokenStatus
parameters.description: Status of the token. ACTIVE INACTIVE SUSPENDED DEACTIVATED

api_reference.title: Get Direct Deposit Switch Token
api_reference.description: Use the Get Direct Deposit Switch Token endpoint to request a token from Galileo to pass to the direct deposit switch provider's SDK. See Setting Up Direct Deposit Switch for instructions on using this endpoint.

parameters.name: apiLogin

parameters.name: apiLogin

parameters.name: fbeDda

api_reference.title: Get Group Hierarchy
api_reference.description: Use the Get Group Hierarchy endpoint to retrieve a group's hierarchy, either a root group or a non-root group. This endpoint returns only the groups, not the associated accounts. By default, the endpoint returns all of the subgroups that are downstream of the specified group. Pass a value for subGroupLevel to specify how many subgroup levels to retrieve. See Creating a Corporate Hierarchy for instructions on using this endpoint.

parameters.description: Identifier of the group (group_id) as returned by the Create Group endpoint. Pattern: Max 10 numeric characters Example: "4522"

parameters.name: subGroupLevel
parameters.description: Level of hierarchy a root group/sub group can have Example: '3'

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

Invalid subGroupLevel. The value in subGroupLevel exceeds the group's maximum level or has an invalid value.

api_reference.title: Get MCC Controls
api_reference.description: Use the Get MCC Controls endpoint to retrieve the MCC controls for either a product ID or an account (PRN). See Set MCC Controls for instructions on using this endpoint.

parameters.name: apiLogin

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN for the account. Do not use the CAD or PAN. Pass this value to retrieve all of the account-level MCC controls for this account. If this parameter is not populated then prodId must be populated. Pattern: PRN (12-digit numeric string) Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: prodId
parameters.description: The Galileo-generated identifier for the product. Pass this value to retrieve all of the product-level MCC controls for this product. If this parameter is not populated then accountNo must be populated. Pattern: Integer Example: 15293

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.description: A system generated timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: pmt_ref_no
parameters.description: The PRN of the account. Returned only when accountNo was passed in the original call.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: The product ID. Returned only when prodId was passed in the original call.

parameters.name: beginning_mcc
parameters.description: The first MCC in the range.

parameters.name: end_mcc
parameters.description: The last MCC in the range. If the control contains only one MCC, this field is either blank or the same value as begMcc.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Starting date-time of the account-level control. Not populated for product-level controls.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Ending date-time of the account-level control. Not populated for product-level controls.

parameters.name: deny_allow_flag
parameters.description: Whether the control is DENY (d) or ALLOW (a).

parameters.name: online_only
parameters.description: Whether the control applies to online (card not present) transactions only. Yâ€”Online only; Nâ€”All transactions

api_reference.title: Get Pending Deposits
api_reference.description: Use the Get Pending Deposits endpoint to retrieve a list of incoming ACH credits that are pending manual review. Populate accountNo to retrieve the pending credits for a specified account or leave accountNo blank to retrieve all pending credits for your program. You can approve or reject these transactions using the CST or the Modify Pending Deposit Status endpoint. Incoming ACH credits are placed into this queue based on the operation fraud settings for your program. See Record-Set Pagination for instructions on using the paging parameters.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for the date range. Must be equal to or later than startDate. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD Example: "2016-01-01"

parameters.name: recordCnt
parameters.description: The maximum number of records per page to be returned. Pattern: P Positive integer 1-99999 Example: 100

api_reference.title: Get Pending Fees
api_reference.description: Use the Get Pending Fees endpoint to retrieve the fees that have not yet been processed against the specified customer account. Most fees are processed as soon as they are created, but if the account has insufficient funds to pay the fee, the fee will be pending until there are sufficient funds. The response data for this endpoint is also available in the Get Account Overview response. The response for each individual pending fee will include authorization-related transaction information, if applicable, which is in the related_transaction data element.

api_reference.title: Get Scheduled Bill Payments
api_reference.description: Use the Get Scheduled Bill Payments endpoint to retrieve the scheduled (recurrent) and future (non-recurrent) bill payments for the specified account. This endpoint returns the next-scheduled payments and all future payments that have a process date of today or later. You can control the pagination as follows: Scheduled payments â€” recordCntScheduled and pageScheduled Future payments â€” recordCntFuture and pageFuture Both scheduled and future payments â€” recordCnt and page. api_reference.title: Get Simulated Incoming ACH Transaction
api_reference.description: Use the Get Simulated Incoming ACH Transaction endpoint to return a pending simulated incoming ACH transaction matching the provided ID. If it has already been processed, use the Get Deposit History or Get All Transaction History endpoints. For instructions on using this endpoint, see Setup for Incoming ACH Transaction Simulation. ðŸš§WarningDo not use this endpoint in Production.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: achTransactionId
parameters.description: The ACH transaction ID to retrieve, as returned by Create Simulated Incoming ACH Transaction. Pattern: Positive integer Example: 14

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

parameters.name: processing_time
parameters.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

parameters.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

parameters.name: provider_transaction_id

parameters.name: system_timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken

parameters.name: template_name
parameters.description: The name of the template used to generate the NACHA file, as set on Create Simulated Incoming ACH Transaction.

api_reference.title: Get Transaction History
api_reference.description: Use the Get Transaction History endpoint to retrieve a list of posted transactions (settlements, payments, adjustments, fees) during a specified timespan. This endpoint does not return unsettled authorizations. As desired, use the act_type field in the response to filter the responses by transaction type. See Record-Set Pagination for instructions on using the paging parameters. Open the Recipe below to see a response example.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The beginning date for the date range, either a date or a date-time. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2016-01-01"

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for the date range, either a date or a date-time. Must be equal to or later than startDate. Max 1098 days (~3 years) after startDate. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2016-01-01"

parameters.name: recordCnt
parameters.description: The maximum number of records per page to be returned. Pattern: Positive integer 1-99999 Example: 100

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The number of the page to retrieve. Pattern: Integer value of 1 or greater Example: 3

parameters.name: includeRelated
parameters.description: Whether to return data for related accounts. See Getting related account information for instructions on using this parameter. Default is 1. Pattern: Integer Example: 0

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

parameters.name: processing_time
parameters.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

parameters.name: provider_timestamp
parameters.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

parameters.name: provider_transaction_id
parameters.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

parameters.name: system_timestamp
parameters.description: A system generated timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date for the transaction range

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date for the transaction range

parameters.name: number_of_pages
parameters.description: The total number of pages available in the paginated response

parameters.name: total_record_count
parameters.description: Number of records in the accounts list display

parameters.name: transaction_count
parameters.description: The number of transactions listed in the response

parameters.name: pmt_ref_no
parameters.description: Galileo-generated account number. Also called the PRN.

parameters.name: act_id
parameters.description: Transaction activity identifier used in Galileo's system

parameters.name: act_type
parameters.description: Identifier for the transaction activity type. See the Activity Type enumeration.

parameters.name: post_ts
parameters.description: Galileo system timestamp when the transaction posted to the customer account, in Mountain Standard Time (-0700)

parameters.name: amt
parameters.description: The transaction amount in the currency of the account. A negative amount debits funds from the customer account.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Description provided by the merchant about the transaction (DE043)

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the activity type specified in the act_type field. See the Activity Type enumeration.

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.description: Galileo-generated identifier that maps to the original transaction, such as auth_id, pmt_id, or adj_id

parameters.name: bal_id
parameters.description: Balance ID, a Galileo-generated identifier for the account on which the transaction occurs. Maps to galileo_account_number.

parameters.name: prod_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the product associated with the account

parameters.name: auth_ts
parameters.description: Galileo system timestamp when the transaction was authorized, in Mountain Standard Time (-0700)

parameters.name: trans_code
parameters.description: Reference your program's activity and transaction types for possible values.

parameters.name: ach_transaction_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the ACH transaction, if applicable

parameters.name: external_trans_id
parameters.description: Optional identifier for a transaction that you supply. External to the Galileo system.

parameters.name: original_auth_id
parameters.description: The auth_id of the previous transaction in the sequence, if any. Maps to prior_id.

parameters.name: network_code
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated code to identify the subnetwork over which the transaction took place. Maps to network_id.

parameters.name: local_amt
parameters.description: Amount, in cents, of the authorization request, in the currency at the point of sale. 12-digit number including leading zeros. This amount does not include upcharges or program fees. (DE004)

parameters.name: local_curr_code
parameters.description: Currency code for local_amt (DE049)

parameters.name: settle_amt
parameters.description: The transaction amount in the settlement currency (DE005)

parameters.name: settle_curr_code
parameters.description: Currency code for settle_amt (DE050)

parameters.name: billing_amt
parameters.description: The transaction amount in the currency of the account (DE006)

parameters.name: billing_curr_code
parameters.description: Currency code for billing_amt (DE051)

parameters.name: mcc
parameters.description: Category code for the merchant that initiated the transaction (DE018)

parameters.name: merchant_id
parameters.description: Network-assigned identifier for a merchant (DE042)

parameters.name: formatted_merchant_desc
parameters.description: The same information as in the details field, with formatting

parameters.name: terminal_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the card reader at the point of sale (DE041)

parameters.name: card_id
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated identifier for a card, which can be used instead of the PAN. Maps to cad.

parameters.name: credit_ind
parameters.description: Indicates whether a PIN was input at the point of sale. Y = No PIN was input. N = A PIN was input. None = Not a card transaction.

parameters.name: iac_tax
parameters.description: Impuesto al Consumo. Colombian consumption tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

parameters.name: iva_tax
parameters.description: Impuesto al Valor Agregado. Colombian value-added tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

parameters.name: funding_account_prn
parameters.description: The PRN of the RTF funding account

parameters.name: spending_account_prn
parameters.description: The PRN of the RTF spending account

parameters.name: original_incremental_id
parameters.description: The original incremental id. The id for the first incremental transaction

parameters.name: latest_incremental_id
parameters.description: The latest incremental id. The id for the most recent transaction
