api_reference.title: Manage Card Token
api_reference.description: Use the Manage Card Token endpoint to delete, suspend, or resume a single token. To use this endpoint, the MTLCM product parameter must be set. This endpoint is currently valid only for Mastercard.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN, PAN or CAD of the account. For card-specific endpoints such as this one, the CAD is preferred. Do not use the PRN if more than one card has ever been associated with this account. Pattern: PAN, PRN, or CAD Example: "999103447228"

parameters.name: tokenUniqueReference
parameters.description: A unique reference assigned to a token and used to identify the token for the duration of its lifetime. Also called the TUR. Pattern: 48-char alphanumeric Example: "DWSPMC00000000010906a349d9ca4eb1a4d53e3c90a11d9c"

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Operation to perform. Pattern: String Example:"SUSPEND"

parameters.name: reasonCode
parameters.description: The reason for operation. See Manage Card Token Values for valid values. Pattern: String Example: "STOLEN"

parameters.name: deleteFromConsumerApp
parameters.description: If operation: DELETE, specify whether to delete the token from the cardholder device only or from both the device and the MDES platform: true â€” Delete the token from the cardholder device only. false â€” Delete the token from both the device and the MDES platform. Pattern: String Example: true

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: token_unique_reference
parameters.description: A unique reference assigned to a token and used to identify the token for the duration of its lifetime.

api_reference.title: Modify ACH Account
api_reference.description: Use the Modify ACH Account endpoint to change an existing ACH account's information. You can add the same ACH account to multiple customer accounts, but you cannot add the same ACH account to the same customer account multiple times. For instructions on using this endpoint see Modifying ACH Accounts in the ACH Endpoints guide.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: achAccountId
parameters.description: ACH account identifier (ach_account_id), as returned by the Add ACH Account or Get ACH Accounts endpoint. Pattern: Positive integer Example: 354656

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The display name of the ACH account. Pattern: Alphanumeric string, max 22 characters Example: "Checking account"

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the external bank account: C â€” Checking S â€” Savings M â€” Money market Pattern: C, S, or M Example: "C"

parameters.name: achAccountNo
parameters.description: External bank account number. Pattern: Max 22 digits Example: "4483434234348"

parameters.name: achRoutingNo
parameters.description: Routing number for the external bank where achAccountNo is housed. Pattern: 9-digit routing number, including check digit Example: "124001545"

parameters.name: entityType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of ACH account to modify: individual (I) or company (C). C is valid only when BTBPG is set at the program level and when the ACH account was created using the Add ACH Account Corporate endpoint. When this value is I then firstName and lastName are required. When this value is C then companyName is required. Pattern: C or I Example: "C"

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Required when entityType: I. First name(s) of the external account holder. Only the first 9 characters of this field are present in the outgoing Nacha file. Pattern: 1â€“40 alphanumeric characters Example: "Maricela Elena"

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Required when entityType: I. Last name(s) of the external account holder. Only the first 12 characters of this field are present in the outgoing Nacha file. Pattern: 1â€“40 alphanumeric characters Example: "Garcia Castro"

parameters.name: companyName
parameters.description: Required when entityType: C. Name of the company that holds the external account. Keep in mind that only the first 22 characters of this name will be present in the outgoing Nacha file. Pattern: 1â€“40 alphanumeric characters Example: "Mountain Star Utilities"

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Unique location identifier (location) as returned by the Create Location endpoint. This value is also returned by the Get Locations endpoint depending on the value of locationType when the location was created: 0 or 2 â€” Returned in the location_id field 1 â€” Returned in the provider_specified_id field Pattern: Integer if locationType: 0 or locationType: 2; max 15 characters if locationType: 1 Example: "a455-3483"

parameters.name: locationType
parameters.description: Type of ID in location: 0 â€” Galileo location ID 1 â€” Partner location ID 2 â€” Don't validate Pattern: 0 or 1 Example: 1

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

parameters.name: processing_time
parameters.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

parameters.name: provider_timestamp
parameters.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

parameters.name: provider_transaction_id
parameters.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

parameters.name: system_timestamp
parameters.description: A system generated timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: ach_account_id
parameters.description: A unique ID for an ACH account

api_reference.title: Modify Location
api_reference.description: Use the Modify Location endpoint to update data elements that are related to the location. Pass only the parameters to be modified â€” leave the rest blank. Nullifying data elements You can pass null for the following parameters to set the value in the database to null. nameaddress1address2cityphoneproviderSpecifiedId

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the location. Pattern: Max 85 alphanumeric characters Example: "ABC Store #5"

parameters.name: address1
parameters.description: First address line of the location. Pattern: 4â€“40 alphanumeric characters Example: "33 Maple Street"

parameters.name: address2
parameters.description: Second address line of the location. Pattern: Max 30 alphanumeric characters Example: "#4B"

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: City for the location. Pattern: Max 30 characters: letters, spaces, hyphen and period Example: "Salt Lake City"

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: State or province for the location. Pattern: 2-character state or province abbreviation Example: "UT"

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Postal (ZIP) code for the location. Pattern: 12345, 12345-1234, K1A-1A1 Example: "84121"

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Country for the location. Three-digit UN M49 code, such as 840 for USA, 124 for Canada, 484 for Mexico, 170 for Colombia. Pattern: Three-digit country code Example: "840"

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Phone number of the location. Pattern: Exactly 10 digits, no hyphens or other characters Example: "8013656060"

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Unique location identifier (location) as returned by the Create Location endpoint. This value is also returned by the Get Locations endpoint depending on the value of locationType when the location was created: 0 or 2 â€” Returned in the location_id field 1 â€” Returned in the provider_specified_id field Pattern: Integer if locationType: 0 or locationType: 2; max 15 characters if locationType: 1 Example: "a455-3483"

parameters.name: locationType
parameters.description: Type of ID in location: 0 â€” Galileo location ID 1 â€” Partner location ID 2 â€” Don't validate Pattern: 0, 1, or 2 Example: 0

parameters.name: providerSpecifiedId

parameters.name: status

parameters.name: store_type

api_reference.title: Modify Location Fee
api_reference.description: Use the Modify Location Fee endpoint to modify a fee that was created with the Create Location Fee endpoint. You cannot change feeType (FBD or DEL) with this endpoint. Instead, you must create a new fee with Create Location Fee and use this endpoint to deactivate the old fee. For this endpoint, amount and amountType are not required, but if one of them is populated, then both are required.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Identifier for the location that was created with Create Location. This value is returned by Get Locations in the location_id field when locationType: 0 or locationType: 2, or in the provider_specified_id field when locationType: 1. Pattern: Must be a number if type is 0; Must be less than or equal to 15 characters if type is 1. Example: "a455-3483"

parameters.name: locationType
parameters.description: Location type, as specified by Create Location. 0=Galileo location ID, 1=Partner location ID, 2=Don't validate. Pattern: 0, 1 or 2 Example: "0"

parameters.name: feeType
parameters.description: Type of fee as specified by Create Location Fee. This value must be the original value provided at the time of the fee creation: FBD (FBE direct deposit fee) or DEL (ACH direct deposit fee) Pattern: FBD or DEL Example: "FBD"

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Specify either a flat amount or a percentage. For a flat amount the valid range is between .01 and 999. For a percentage the valid range is .01 (1%) to 1 (100%). When this parameter is populated then amountType is required. Pattern: 1, 1.10, 0.5 Example: 1.23

parameters.name: amountType
parameters.description: Specify whether the value in amount is a flat rate (flat) or a percentage (percent). When this parameter is populated then amount is required. Pattern: flat or percent Example: 'flat'

parameters.name: minFee
parameters.description: The minimum amount for the fee, if the amount type is a percentage. Pattern: 10, 20.5, 2.33 Example: 1.10

parameters.name: maxFee
parameters.description: The maximum amount for the fee, if the amount type is a percentage. Pattern: 10, 20.5, 2.33 Example: 1.10

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Specify whether to activate the fee (Y) or deactivate the fee (N). Pattern: Y or N Example: "Y"

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

parameters.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

parameters.name: provider_timestamp
parameters.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

parameters.name: provider_transaction_id
parameters.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

parameters.name: system_timestamp
parameters.description: A system generated timestamp

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: provider_specified_id
parameters.description: Customer ID of the location, when locationType is 1.

parameters.name: min_fee
parameters.description: The minimum amount to charge, when amount_type is percent.

parameters.name: amount_type
parameters.description: The type of the amount: flat or percent.

parameters.name: max_fee
parameters.description: The maximum amount to charge, when amount_type is percent.

parameters.name: fee_type
parameters.description: Type of fee, FBD (FBE direct deposit fee) or DEL (ACH direct deposit fee).

Fee doest not exist.
locationType 1 name is maximum of 15 characters.
locationType 0 and 2 require location to be an integer value.

api_reference.title: Modify Paper Biller
api_reference.description: Use the Modify Paper Biller endpoint to update a paper biller. All non-required fields are nullifiable. To cancel a scheduled series, either set endDate to the current date or pass Null for frequencyType, nextDate and endDate. The account must be active (status: N) to use this endpoint.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: billerId
parameters.description: Identifier for the biller (biller_id) as returned by the Add Paper Biller or Get Billers endpoint. Pattern: Integer Example: 2982

parameters.name: frequencyType
parameters.description: Frequency of the bill payment: O â€” One time W â€” Weekly M â€” Monthly Q â€” Quarterly Y â€” Yearly If this value is not O then nextDate and endDate are required. Pattern: One letter Example: "W"

parameters.name: nextDate
parameters.description: The next date that the payment is scheduled. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD Example: "2015-02-04"

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The last date that the payment is scheduled. Can be up to five years in the future, so if today is 20 Jan 2020, this parameter can be no later than 20 Jan 2025. However, if today's date is a leap day, such as 29 Feb 2020, the latest date can be 1 Mar 2025. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD Example: "2015-02-04"

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Currency amount as a whole or decimal amount. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: billerAddress1
parameters.description: First line of the biller address. Pattern: Max 80 alphanumeric characters Example: "33 Maple Street"

parameters.name: billerAddress2
parameters.description: Second line of biller address. Pattern: Max 30 alphanumeric characters Example: "#4B"

parameters.name: billerCity
parameters.description: Biller city. Pattern: Max 30 letters and spaces Example: "Salt Lake City"

parameters.name: billerState
parameters.description: Biller state or province. Pattern: 2-character state or provincial abbreviation Example: "UT"

parameters.name: billerZip
parameters.description: Biller postal code. Pattern: 12345, 12345-1234, or K1A-1A1 Example: "84121"

parameters.name: billerPhone
parameters.description: Biller phone number or "null". Pattern: Exactly 10 digits, no hyphens or other characters or "null" Example: "8013656060"

parameters.name: rtoken

parameters.description: The ID assigned to the biller

parameters.name: address_1
parameters.description: First address line of the biller

parameters.name: address_2

api_reference.title: Modify Pending Deposit Status
api_reference.description: Use the Modify Pending Deposit Status endpoint to either post or return pending direct ACH deposits that are returned by Get Pending Deposits. This endpoint is intended for a custom fraud monitoring and resolution strategy. Consult with Galileo to configure your program appropriately. For more information on this endpoint see Modifying a pending ACH deposit status in the ACH Endpoints guide.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: Identifier supplied by the provider, which is not related to the Galileo system. This ID is stored in the Galileo system in association with this account and can be provided in the RDFs. Pattern: Max 30 alphanumeric characters. Lowercase only. Example: "553b45sbs"

parameters.name: depositTransactionId
parameters.description: The ACH transaction identifier (ach_trans_id), as returned by the Get Pending Deposits endpoint. Pattern: Positive integer Example: 6844743

parameters.name: actionType
parameters.description: Action to take on the pending deposit: P â€” Post the deposit R â€” Return the deposit to the sender. When returning the deposit, retCode is required Pattern: Single character Example: "P"

parameters.name: categoryCode
parameters.description: Category to assign to the deposit. See Deposit Category Codes for valid values. Pattern: Three-letter code Example: "TAX"

parameters.name: categoryType
parameters.description: Indicates the decision for future ACH deposits that match the program settings for the current deposit. Values are: A â€” Approve matching transactions. D â€” Decline matching transactions. W â€” Watch matching transactions and send for manual review. Pattern: Must be A, W or D Example: "D"

parameters.name: retCode
parameters.description: Reason for returning the deposit. This parameter is required when actionType: R. See the Return Codes table for valid values. Pattern: 3-character code Example: "R02"

parameters.name: response-content-type
parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

parameters.description: The condition of a process or response

parameters.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

parameters.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

parameters.name: rtoken
parameters.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

parameters.name: deposit_transaction_id
parameters.description: A unique system generated ID number that identifies the deposit

parameters.name: action_type
parameters.description: 'P' and 'R' (Post and Return). Post = pending (ACH) deposit, Return = return the pending deposit

parameters.name: category_type
parameters.description: A = Approve; W = Watch; D = Decline

parameters.name: category_code
parameters.description: COF=Questionable IAT Country; CRN= Unauthorized IAT Country; L=Large Xfer Amount > 4000; LRG=Large Xfer 4000; NAME=Name miss match; TAX=Tax

api_reference.title: Modify Status
api_reference.description: Use the Modify Status endpoint to change the status of an account, a card, or both. This endpoint does not change any other kind of status. Consult the Modify Status Types enumeration to see what is affected by each type value. Use this endpoint with type: 7 to activate a virtual card; for physical card activation use the Activate Card endpoint. See the Lost, Stolen, or Damaged Cards guide for instructions on using types 8 and 9.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN, PAN or CAD of the account. Pattern: PAN, PRN, or CAD Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specifies the account and/or card status to set. See the Modify Status Types enumeration for valid values. Pattern: Predefined integer value range Example: 2

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Valid only with type: 17 (freeze card). If you pass a value for startDate, you must also populate endDate. Default is current date-time. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2020-02-02 12:22:02"

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Valid only with type: 17 (freeze card). If you pass a value for endDate, you must also populate startDate. Must be later than startDate. Default is current date-time plus 24 hours. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2020-02-12 10:00:00"

parameters.name: bypassRepFee
parameters.description: Valid only when type: 19. Pass Y to bypass the card replacement fee (REP). Pattern: String Example: "Y"

parameters.name: cardNumberLastFour
parameters.description: If multiple cards are associated with this account, use this value to ensure that the correct card is selected. Pattern: 4 digits Example: "0789"

parameters.name: closureReason
parameters.description: Specifies the account closure reason. See the Account Closure Reasons enumeration for valid values. Only valid when type contains 2, 13, 16 or 20. Default: paid_user. Pattern: String

parameters.name: bypassMailFee
parameters.description: Controls whether to charge the express mail fee for the reissued card. Default: blank. Pattern: "Y" or blank Example: "Y"

api_reference.title: Recover Charged-Off Account
api_reference.description: Use the Recover Charged-Off Account endpoint to change a charged-off account (status: R) to another status (active or canceled without refund) and to restore the account balance. Using this endpoint is valid only when there was an outstanding positive balance at the time of charge-off.

parameters.name: chargeOffRecoveryAmt
parameters.description: The amount to restore to the recovered account. Cannot be more than what the account contained when it was charged off. Pattern: Monetary amount 0 or greater. Example: 100.00, 100, 100.73

api_reference.title: Reissue Card
api_reference.description: Use the Reissue Card endpoint to reissue a card, which means to send the card to the embosser again. Specify whether to keep the same PAN and expiry date as the original card. This endpoint also changes the status of the original card. Galileo recommends that you use the CAD for accountNo; however, you can use the PRN if only one card has ever been associated with the account. Galileo recommends that you use this endpoint instead of Modify Status with type: 12 to reissue cards. For instructions see the Reissuing Cards guide. ðŸ“˜NoteThe expiry_date and card_security_code (CVV2) that are returned by the endpoint are not the new values. The new values are generated later by the emboss process. Call Get Card to retrieve the new values after the emboss process has run.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN, PAN or CAD of the account. Pattern: PAN, PRN, or CAD Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: newPan
parameters.description: Controls whether to generate a new PAN for the reissued card. Default: N. Pattern: Y or N Example: "Y"

parameters.name: newExpiryDate
parameters.description: Controls whether to generate a new expiration date for the reissued card. Always set this value to Y. Pattern: Y Example: "Y"

parameters.name: emboss
parameters.description: Controls whether to send the reissued card to the embosser. Because virtual cards cannot be reissued, the value N is not supported. Pattern: Y or blank Example: "Y"

parameters.name: oldCardStatus
parameters.description: Specifies the status to set for the card that is being replaced. Status is set by the emboss process. Valid values are C, D or blank. Default: blank Pattern: C, D or blank Example: D

parameters.name: bypassMailFee
parameters.description: Controls whether to charge the express mail fee for the reissued card. Default: blank. Pattern: Y or blank Example: Y

Insufficient funds to cover reissue fee. Follow your business process for this use case.
Failure, generic error processing reissue fee. Contact Galileo for troubleshooting.
Failure, card has pending reissue records. No next steps. The pending emboss record will be sent to the embosser in the next cycle.
Card reissue cannot be processed. Contact Galileo for troubleshooting.
If new_pan='Y' then new_expiry_date needs to be 'Y' too. Verify that newExpiryDate: Y when newPan: Y.
Failure. You cannot reissue a card in status Lost or Stolen with the same PAN (newPan: N) and same expiry date (newExpiryDate: N).

api_reference.title: Replace Lost/Stolen Card
api_reference.description: Use the Replace Lost/Stolen Card endpoint to report a card as lost or stolen and to request a replacement card. This endpoint is valid only for physical cards and Digital First cards. The response from this endpoint includes the new PAN, new expiry date, and new CVV for the replacement card. You must be PCI-compliant to receive the full PAN; otherwise, you will receive a masked PAN.

parameters.description: Galileo issued unique Provider identifier. Pattern: 10 digits or less Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique system generated ID number that identifies the API transaction with Galileo Processing systems. A UUID is preferred. This must be different for each transaction. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: bypassRepFee
parameters.description: Pass Y to bypass the card replacement fee (REP). Pattern: Y or N Example: "Y"

parameters.name: cardStatus
parameters.description: Specifies whether the card is being marked as lost (L) or stolen (S). Default: L. Pattern: L or S Example: L

parameters.name: cardNumberLastFour
parameters.description: If multiple cards are associated with this account, use this value to ensure that the correct card is selected. Pattern: 4 digits Example: "0789"

api_reference.title: Reverse Account Transfer
api_reference.description: Use the Reverse Account Transfer endpoint to reverse out a transaction made with the Create Account Transfer endpoint. Only a successful Create Account Transfer transaction (response status: 0) can be reversed using Reverse Account Transfer. Pass the transactionId of the endpoint request to be reversed instead of passing a new value. Pass the original sending account in accountNo. Consult the Creating an Internal Transfer guide for instructions on using this endpoint.

parameters.name: apiLogin

api_reference.title: Search Accounts
api_reference.description: Use the Search Accounts endpoint to find a customer account by searching on at least one of the parameters. The data in the response is similar to what the Galileo CST search provides. For the recordCnt parameter use these values to get the desired number of records per page: No value â€” 50 records per page 1 through 100 â€” The specified number of records per page Values over 100 â€” 100 records per page

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN or PAN of the account. Pattern: PAN or PRN Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Account holder's first name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "Ed"

parameters.name: middleName
parameters.description: Account holder's middle name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "W"

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Account holder's last name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "Harley"

parameters.name: dateOfBirth
parameters.description: Account holder's birth date. This date is compared with the DOB product parameter when there is a minimum age requirement on the account. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD Example: "1980-01-01"

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Account holder's postal code (ZIP code). Pattern: 12345, 12345-1234, or K1A-1A1 Example: "84121"

parameters.name: primaryPhone
parameters.description: Account holder's primary phone number. When passing a value for this parameter, you must also pass mobilePhoneCountryCode. Pattern: Validation according to the value in mobilePhoneCountryCode. Example: "8013656050"

parameters.name: otherPhone
parameters.description: Account holder's secondary phone number. When passing a value for this parameter, you must also pass mobilePhoneCountryCode. Pattern: Validation according to the value in mobilePhoneCountryCode. Example: "8013656050"

parameters.name: mobilePhone
parameters.description: Account holder's mobile phone number. When passing a value for this parameter, you must also pass mobilePhoneCountryCode. Pattern: Validation according to the value in mobilePhoneCountryCode. Example: "8013656050"

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Account holder's email. This field is validated by Marshmallow. Pattern: Email address, 3â€“63 characters Example: "user@fakedomain.com"

parameters.name: userData
parameters.description: Data supplied by the provider, from sources external to the Galileo system. This data will be stored in the Galileo system in association with this account. The most common use of this parameter is to track affiliate-marketing traffic. The data in this field can be added to an RDF. Pattern: Max 50 alphanumeric characters and spaces Example: "a4434gg44"

parameters.name: eextid
parameters.description: The externalAccountId that was passed in the account-creation call. Pattern: Max 30 alphanumeric characters Example: "553b45sbs"

parameters.name: recordCnt
parameters.description: The maximum number of records per page to be returned. Pattern: Positive integer 1-99999 Example: 100

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The number of the page to retrieve. Pattern: Integer value of 1 or greater Example: 3

parameters.name: mobilePhoneCountryCode
parameters.description: Account holder's mobile phone country code. Pattern: A plus sign followed by 1â€“3 digits. See Phone Validation for valid values. Example: "+1"

parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

api_reference.title: Search Biller Directory
api_reference.description: Use the Search Biller Directory endpoint to find billers in the RPPS database. Pass billerName (required), billerState (recommended) and billerAccountNo (optional). If the biller is in the RPPS database, the endpoint returns the RPPS biller ID (rpps_biller_id), which you pass in the Add RPPS Biller endpoint call. If the biller is not present, use Add Paper Biller to add the biller. If the biller is present in the RPPS directory, the endpoint might return biller_account_no_patterns, which you can use as a mask to validate the account number. See Creating a Billpay Transaction for instructions on using this endpoint.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey

parameters.description: Valid biller account number. As applicable, this value is validated against a biller-supplied mask. Pattern: A Max 60 alphanumeric characters including space and hyphen Example: "3333223323455555"

parameters.name: billerName
parameters.description: Pass a complete or partial name of a biller to begin the search. When a single term returns multiple entries, the account holder must select from among them. Pass billerState and/or billerAccountNo to filter the results. Pattern: Max 50 alphanumeric characters, no punctuation Example: "Netflix"

api_reference.title: Set Account Feature
api_reference.description: Use the Set Account Feature endpoint to set or modify specified attributes of a customer account. When enabling and disabling fraud rules (featureType: 14), keep in mind that if you pass featureValue: Y and do not pass endDate, the end date is set to 3000-01-01, meaning that fraud rules are suspended indefinitely. To update the timespan for fraud-rule suspension, pass featureValue: Y and the new start and/or end date-times. To immediately re-enable fraud rules, pass featureValue: N. When featureValue: N, the date fields are ignored. When you change account features 20, 21 or 22, you can arrange with Galileo to receive the ACFC: account_feature_change event message. ðŸ“˜NoteFeature types 20, 21, and 22 are mutually exclusive. Only one can be set to Y at a time.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey

parameters.description: The PRN, PAN or CAD of the account. Pattern: PAN, PRN, or CAD Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: featureType
parameters.description: Consult the featureType column in the Set Account Feature Values table for valid values. Pattern: Integer Example: 3

parameters.name: featureValue
parameters.description: Consult the featureValue column in the Set Account Feature Values table for valid values. Pattern: As specified in the featureValue column Example: Y

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The starting date-time for the date range. Default: current date-time Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2016-01-01 10:10:15"

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The ending date-time for the date range; must be equal to or later than startDate. Default: 3000-01-01 00:01:00 Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: "2016-02-01 10:10:10"

api_reference.title: Set Account-Level Auth Control
api_reference.description: Use the Set Account-Level Auth Control endpoint to create or modify an account-level velocity control. Prior to calling this endpoint, call Get Auth Control to get the controlId for the control to set or modify. See Set Velocity Controls for instructions on using this endpoint. To update existing velocity ALCs, see Updating velocity ALCs.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN for the account. Do not use the CAD or PAN. Pattern: 12-digit numeric string Example: "344101254935"

parameters.name: controlId
parameters.description: The control ID of the velocity control to set or modify, as returned by Get Auth Control. Pattern: Integer, max 18 digits Example: 10492

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount of the new limit. If this parameter is not populated when creating a new control, then transactionCount is required Pattern: Decimal number (14, 2) Example: 500.00

parameters.name: transactionCount
parameters.description: New number of transactions to permit. If this parameter is not populated when creating a new control, then amount is required. Pattern: Integer, maximum 18 digits Example: 5

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date-time for the control. Can be set up to six months in the future. Cannot be in the past. Must be earlier than endDate. Default: Current Galileo system time Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss or YYYY-MM-DD Example: "2022-03-03 00:00:00"

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date-time for the control. Must be later than startDate. Cannot be in the past. Default: 3000-01-01 00:00:00. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss or YYYY-MM-DD Example: "2022-03-10 23:59:59"

status_codes.description: Failure, generic error, return values are invalid. Contact Galileo for troubleshooting.
Failure, control_id does not exist. Use a valid value for controlId.
Failure, prod_id is not configured to use specified control_id. Call Get Auth Control with prodId populated to retrieve valid control_ids for this products.
Failure, an optional parameter is required for update/insert
Failure, start_date is later than end_date

Failure, the amount and/or transaction-count values provided are in conflict with another ALC with the same PRN and control ID. The amount and transaction-count limits for an ALC without MCCs must be greater than or equal to the amounts and transaction counts of ALCs with MCCs. Please adjust the amount and/or transaction-count values.
Failure, the provided MCC range overlaps with an existing account-level MCC limit. Please use a different MCC range. Call Get Auth Control with accountNo populated to retrieve existing ALCs.
Failure, the provided MCC range overlaps with an existing account-level or product-level MCC control. Please use a different MCC range. Call Get MCC Controls to retrieve existing MCC controls.

api_reference.title: Set Roundup Accounts
api_reference.description: Use the Set Roundup Accounts endpoint to specify the roundup account for a consumer account, such as rounding up into a charity account. (To enable roundup for the account, call Set Account Feature with type: 11.) You can assign multiple roundup accounts to a single consumer account. The total percentage from all linked roundup accounts must equal 100.

api_reference.title: Start Enrollment
api_reference.description: Use the Start Enrollment endpoint to initiate a new enrollment and run CIP. This endpoint is different from Create Account in that it creates a customer record but does not create an account or card. Consult the Customer ID Verification guide for instructions on using this endpoint with Galileo's integrated CIP solution. ðŸ“˜NoteIf this endpoint returns a status code that does not match a status code that is specific to this endpoint, it may be an enrollment status code. See Enrollment Statuses for more information.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: prodId
parameters.description: Galileo-generated identifier for a product. If this ID is for a business product then businessName is required. Pattern: Integer Example: 501

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The value of the primary identifier that is specified in idType. Product settings determine whether this ID should be unique across the program or product. This parameter is required when using Galileo's integrated CIP solution. Galileo converts all letters to lowercase. Pattern: As specified in the Layout column of the Customer ID Types enumeration Example: "123456789"

parameters.name: idType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of primary identifier in the id parameter. This parameter is required when id is populated. See the ID column in the Customer ID Types table for valid values. Pattern: 1- or 2-digit integer Example: 2

parameters.name: id2
parameters.description: Secondary identifier for an account holder. Galileo converts all letters to lowercase. Pattern: See Customer ID Types Example: "123456789012|ut|12/25/2020"

parameters.name: idType2
parameters.description: Specifies the type of secondary identifier in the id2 parameter. This parameter is required when id2 is populated. See the ID column in the Customer ID Types table for valid values. Pattern: 1- or 2-digit integer Example: 1

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Unique location identifier (location) as returned by the Create Location endpoint. This value is also returned by the Get Locations endpoint depending on the value of locationType when the location was created: 0 or 2 â€” Returned in the location_id field 1 â€” Returned in the provider_specified_id field Pattern: Integer if locationType: 0 or locationType: 2; max 15 characters if locationType: 1 Example: "a455-3483"

parameters.name: locationType
parameters.description: Type of ID in location: 0 â€” Galileo location ID 1 â€” Partner location ID 2 â€” Don't validate Pattern: Integer Example: 1

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The account holder language and localization preference. If the account holder address is outside the U.S., pass a non _US value for this parameter to disable U.S. address validation. Pattern: String Example: "en_US"

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Account holder's first name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "Ed"

parameters.name: middleName
parameters.description: Account holder's middle name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "W"

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Account holder's last name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "Harley"

parameters.name: dateOfBirth
parameters.description: Account holder's birth date. This date is compared with the DOB product parameter when there is a minimum age requirement on the account. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD Example: "1980-01-01"

parameters.name: address1
parameters.description: Account holder's first address line. Cannot be a P.O. box. Validation rules for address1. Pattern: 4â€“40 alphanumeric characters Example: "33 Maple Street"

parameters.name: address2
parameters.description: Account holder's second address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 40 characters Example: "#4B"

parameters.name: address3
parameters.description: Account holder's third address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: "Carrera Central"

parameters.name: address4
parameters.description: Account holder's fourth address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: "Barrio El Alhambra"

parameters.name: address5
parameters.description: Account holder's fifth address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: "Piso 3"

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Account holder's city. Pattern: Max 30 characters: letters, spaces, hyphen and period Example: "Salt Lake City"

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Account holder's state or province. Pattern: 2,3-character state or province abbreviation Example: "UT"

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Account holder's postal code (ZIP code). Pattern: 12345, 12345-1234, or K1A-1A1 Example: "84121"

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Account holder's country. Three-digit UN M49 code, such as 840 for USA, 124 for Canada, 484 for Mexico, 170 for Colombia. Pattern: 3-digit number Example: "840"

parameters.name: expressMail
parameters.description: Legacy values of Y or N were used to determine express shipping of new card. 'Y' maps to '2' and 'N' maps to '1'. 0-9 were added to allow for additional express shipping options. Values should only be used that are supported by the emboss vendor for the program. Pattern: Y, N, or 0-9 Example: "1"

parameters.name: primaryPhone
parameters.description: Account holder's primary phone number. Pattern: Validation according to the value in mobilePhoneCountryCode. Example: "8013656060"

parameters.name: otherPhone
parameters.description: Account holder's secondary phone number. Pattern: Validation according to the value in mobilePhoneCountryCode. Example: "8013656060"

parameters.name: mobilePhone
parameters.description: Account holder's mobile phone number. Pattern: Validation according to the value in mobilePhoneCountryCode. Example: "8013656060"

parameters.name: mobileCarrierId
parameters.description: Account holder's mobile carrier. Configurable list. Pattern: Configurable list Example: "8"

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Account holder's email. This field is validated by Marshmallow. Pattern: Email address, 3â€“63 characters Example: "user@fakedomain.com"

parameters.name: webUid
parameters.description: Account holder's username for the Galileo-hosted website. Must be unique across the program. Pattern: Alphanumeric, with first character a letter; case insensitive Example: "eharley"

parameters.name: webPwd
parameters.description: Account holder's password for the Galileo-hosted website. Pattern: Min 8 characters: must include upper-case character, lower-case character, and a number Example: "4j9KH3kkdh"

parameters.name: secretQuestion
parameters.description: Account holder's secret question for the Galileo-hosted website. Pattern: Max 50 characters: letters, spaces, ? Example: "What was the name of your first pet?"

parameters.name: secretAnswer
parameters.description: Account holder's answer to secretQuestion. Pattern: Max 50 characters: letters, spaces, ? Example: "Larry"

parameters.name: userData
parameters.description: Data supplied by the provider, from sources external to the Galileo system. This data will be stored in the Galileo system in association with this account. The most common use of this parameter is to track affiliate-marketing traffic. The data in this field can be added to an RDF. Pattern: Max 50 alphanumeric characters and spaces Example: "a4434gg44"

parameters.name: verifyOnly
parameters.description: Pass 1 to test the validity of the parameter data without committing the information to the Galileo system. Pattern: Integer Example: 1

parameters.name: monthlyIncome
parameters.description: Currency amounts passed as whole or fractional amounts, examples: '100.00', '100', or '100.73'. Pattern: Monetary amount 0 or greater. Example: 25.50

parameters.name: monthlyLiab
parameters.description: Currency amounts passed as whole or fractional amounts, examples: '100.00', '100', or '100.73'. Pattern: Monetary amount 0 or greater. Example: 25.50

parameters.name: runCip
parameters.description: Specifies whether to run CIP on the customer. Valid only when using Galileo's integrated CIP solution. 0 â€” Do not run CIP 1 â€” Run CIP Pattern: Integer Example: 1

parameters.name: businessName
parameters.description: Account holder's business name. This field is required if prodId is a business product. Pattern: 2-150 characters. See the supported character set. Example: "Ed%26Ted"

parameters.name: mobilePhoneCountryCode
parameters.description: Account holder's mobile phone country code. Pattern: A plus sign followed by 1â€“3 digits. See Phone Validation for valid values. Example: "+1"

api_reference.title: Switch Product
api_reference.description: Use the Switch Product endpoint to change the product ID on the specified account to a new product ID. To control whether the product switch triggers a card reissue, set doReissue. For prodId pass the new product ID. This endpoint is valid only for card-account products. For products that do not have a card, use Set Account Feature with type: 3 to switch products. Galileo recommends that you use the CAD for accountNo; however, you can use the PRN if only one card has ever been associated with the account. For instructions on using this endpoint, see the Switching Products guide. ðŸ“˜NoteThe expiry_date and card_security_code (CVV2) that are returned by the endpoint are not the new values. The new values are generated later by the emboss process. Call Get Card to retrieve the new values after the emboss process has run.

parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: The PRN, PAN or CAD of the account. Pattern: PAN, PRN, or CAD Example: "074103447228"

parameters.name: prodId

parameters.name: doReissue
parameters.description: Controls whether to reissue the card. Default: "N". Pattern: String Example: "Y"

parameters.name: newPan

parameters.name: newExpiryDate
parameters.description: Controls whether to generate a new expiry date for the reissued card. If newPan: Y then this value must be "Y". Pattern: String Example: "Y"

parameters.name: emboss
parameters.description: Controls whether to emboss the reissued card. Pattern: String Example: "Y"

parameters.name: oldCardStatus
parameters.description: Specifies the status to set for the card that is being replaced. Status is set by the emboss process. Default: blank Pattern: String or blank Example: "D"

status_codes.description: Product cannot be switched to the same product. Verify that prodId is different from the account's current product ID.
Product cannot be switched to an unauthorized product. Verify that prodId is a valid product ID.

Product has been successfully switched but card reissue failed: The valid values for newPanFlag and newExpirationDate include Y/N. Call Reissue Card to complete the reissue, and verify that newPanFlag and newExpiryDate are set to Y, N or blank
Trying to update card status without requesting new PAN. The product has not been successfully switched and card reissue failed. If newPan is N or blank then oldCardStatus must be blank.

Product has been successfully switched but card reissue failed: The valid values for oldCardStatus include D/C. Call Reissue Card to complete the reissue and verify that oldCardStatus is set to C, D or blank.

Product has been successfully switched but card reissue failed: Trying to update card status without requesting new PAN. Call Reissue Card to complete the reissue. If newPan is N or blank then oldCardStatus must be blank.

Product has been successfully switched but card reissue failed: Failure getting data associated with account/card. Cannot retrieve CAD, ENP or product ID. Call Reissue Card to complete the reissue or contact Galileo for troubleshooting.
Product has been successfully switched but card reissue failed: Failure getting data associated with account/card. CAD or XID is null. Contact Galileo for troubleshooting.
Product has been successfully switched but card reissue failed: Insufficient funds to cover reissue fee. Follow your business process for this use case.
Product has been successfully switched but card reissue failed: Failure, generic error processing reissue fee. Contact Galileo for troubleshooting.
If new_pan='Y' then new_expiry_date needs to be 'Y' too. Product did not switch. Verify that newExpiryDate: Y when newPan: Y.

Product has been successfully switched but card reissue failed: card has pending reissue records. There is an emboss record in status: Y with the same product ID as the new product ID. This is a common status during testing when switching the same account repeatedly between products. If the existing emboss record is the desired emboss record, take no action. That card will be sent to the cardholder. If you are testing, call Activate Card to activate the existing emboss record and then call Reissue Card to complete the reissue.
Product has been successfully switched but card reissue failed: Card reissue cannot be processed. Contact Galileo for troubleshooting.

api_reference.title: Update Account
api_reference.description: Use the Update Account endpoint to modify customer profile information in an existing customer record. Pass only the parameters to modify â€” other parameters should be left blank. Only active accounts (status: N) can be updated using this endpoint, unless you set provider parameter UPDCZ to update accounts in status: C or status: Z. Nullifying data elements Pass the string null for any of these parameters to update that value to null. firstNamemiddleNamelastNameaddress1citystatepostalCodeprimaryPhoneotherPhonemobilePhoneshipToAddress1webUidsecretQuestionsecretAnswermailBouncedemail*embossLine2 *Only if the provider parameter AENUL is set. ðŸš§WarningExercise caution when nullifying a primary address â€” for compliance in the United States you must maintain a physical address as an individual cardholder's primary address. Updating customer ID When you are using Galileo's integrated CIP process, you can update the primary customer ID (id and idType) as long as the customer has not passed CIP. If the customer has already passed CIP, status code 415-02 is returned. Secondary customer ID (id2 and idType2) can be updated regardless of customer CIP status. Updating the ship-to address When updating the ship-to address for a customer, the elements shipToAddress1, shipToCity, shipToState, and shipToPostalCode are required â€“ shipToAddress2 is optional. You can retrieve the current customer ship-to address data using the Get Account Cards endpoint. By default, the embosser sends the card to the primary address. To ship to a different address than the primary, use the ship-to address fields. If you pass shipToAddressPermanent: 1 the embosser will always send cards to the ship-to address; otherwise, the ship-to address is used only for the current order.

parameters.description: Galileo-generated identifier for a product. If this ID is for a business product then businessName is required. Pattern: Integer Example: 501

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Primary identifier for an account holder. Galileo converts all letters to lowercase. Pattern: See Customer ID Types Example: "123456789"

parameters.name: idType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of primary identifier in the id parameter. This parameter is required when id is populated. See the ID column in the Customer ID Types table for valid values. Pattern: 1- or 2-digit integer Example: 2

parameters.name: id2
parameters.description: Secondary identifier for an account holder. Galileo converts all letters to lowercase. Pattern: See Customer ID Types Example: "123456789012|ut|12/25/2020"

parameters.name: idType2
parameters.description: Specifies the type of secondary identifier in the id2 parameter. This parameter is required when id2 is populated. See the ID column in the Customer ID Types table for valid values. Pattern: 1- or 2-digit integer Example: 1

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Account holder's first name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "Ed"

parameters.name: middleName
parameters.description: Account holder's middle name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "W"

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Account holder's last name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "Harley"

parameters.name: dateOfBirth
parameters.description: Account holder's birth date. This date is compared with the DOB product parameter when there is a minimum age requirement on the account. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD Example: "1980-01-01"

parameters.name: address1
parameters.description: Account holder's first address line. Cannot be a P.O. box. Validation rules for address1. Pattern: 4â€“40 alphanumeric characters Example: "33 Maple Street"

parameters.name: address2
parameters.description: Account holder's second address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 40 characters Example: "#4B"

parameters.name: address3
parameters.description: Account holder's third address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: "Carrera Central"

parameters.name: address4
parameters.description: Account holder's fourth address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: "Barrio El Alhambra"

parameters.name: address5
parameters.description: Account holder's fifth address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: "Piso 3"

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The account holder language and localization preference. If the account holder address is outside the U.S., pass a non _US value for this parameter to disable U.S. address validation. Pattern: String Example: "en_US"

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Account holder's city. Pattern: Max 30 characters: letters, spaces, hyphen and period Example: "Salt Lake City"

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Account holder's state or province. Pattern: 2,3-character state or province abbreviation Example: "UT"

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Account holder's postal code (ZIP code). Pattern: 12345, 12345-1234, or K1A-1A1 Example: "84121"

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Account holder's country. Three-digit UN M49 code, such as 840 for USA, 124 for Canada, 484 for Mexico, 170 for Colombia. Pattern: 3-digit number Example: "840"

parameters.name: primaryPhone
parameters.description: Account holder's primary phone number. Pattern: Exactly 10 digits, no hyphens or other characters Example: "8013656060"

parameters.name: otherPhone
parameters.description: Phone number. Pattern: Exactly 10 digits, no hyphens or other characters Example: "8013656060"

parameters.name: mobilePhone
parameters.description: Phone number. Pattern: Exactly 10 digits, no hyphens or other characters Example: "8013656060"

parameters.name: mobileCarrierId
parameters.description: Account holder's mobile carrier. Configurable list. Pattern: Configurable list Example: "8"

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Account holder's email. This field is validated by Marshmallow. Pattern: Email address, 3â€“63 characters Example: "user@fakedomain.com"

parameters.name: webUid
parameters.description: Account holder's username for the Galileo-hosted website. Must be unique across the program. Pattern: Alphanumeric, with first character a letter; case insensitive Example: "eharley"

parameters.name: webPwd
parameters.description: Account holder's password for the Galileo-hosted website. Pattern: Min 8 characters: must include upper-case character, lower-case character, and a number Example: "4j9KH3kkdh"

parameters.name: secretQuestion
parameters.description: Account holder's secret question for the Galileo-hosted website. Pattern: Max 50 characters: letters, spaces, ? Example: "What was the name of your first pet?"

parameters.name: secretAnswer
parameters.description: Account holder's answer to secretQuestion. Pattern: Max 50 characters: letters, spaces, ? Example: "Larry"

parameters.name: monthlyIncome
parameters.description: Currency amount as a whole or decimal amount. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: monthlyLiab
parameters.description: Currency amount as a whole or decimal amount. Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number Example: 100.00, 100, or 100.73

parameters.name: businessName
parameters.description: Account holder's business name. This field is required if prodId is a business product. Pattern: 2-150 characters. See the supported character set. Example: "Ed%26Ted"

parameters.description: Use this header instead of the standard accept header to specify the response format.

api_reference.title: Update Federal Benefit Enrollment
api_reference.description: Use the Update Federal Benefits Enrollment endpoint to modify an existing federal benefits enrollment prior to re-submitting it with the Resubmit Federal Benefit Enrollment endpoint.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: fbeStatusId
parameters.description: The ID parameter value references the Federal Benefits enrollment to be updated. Pattern: Integer value as returned by getFbEnrollments(). Example: 38437

parameters.name: recipientType
parameters.description: Specifies whether the owner of the account in accountNo is a direct recipient or a beneficiary: 0 â€” Direct recipient 1 â€” Beneficiary Pattern: 0 or 1 Example: 1

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Account holder's first name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "Ed"

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Account holder's last name. Special character support. Pattern: 1â€“40 characters: letters (A-Z, a-z), spaces, hyphens (-) and single quotes (') Example: "Harley"

parameters.name: ssn
parameters.description: The Social Security number of the direct recipient of the disbursement. Pattern: 9-digit Social Security number, no hyphens Example: "123456789"

parameters.name: agencyType
parameters.description: One of several defined agency types. Pattern: See the Federal Benefit Enrollment Agency Types table in Enumerations. Example: "SOCIAL SECURITY"

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Specifies the state of the federal benefits enrollment. See the Federal Benefit Enrollment Statuses enumeration for valid values. Pattern: One character Example: "B"

parameters.name: earlyAccess
parameters.description: Specifies whether the account is participating in early access. Pattern: Y or N Example: "Y"

parameters.name: agentId
parameters.description: Identifier of the agent, for use in transaction reporting and tracking. Pattern: Integer Example: 109405

parameters.name: middleName
parameters.description: Middle name of the beneficiary.Middle names are not used in ENR transactions, but they are included here for parity between the Account Management and Federal Benefit Enrollment data models. Pattern: String Example: James

api_reference.title: Update Group
api_reference.description: Use the Update Group endpoint to update an existing group, either a root group or a non-root group. Pass only the parameter(s) to update. All of the name parameters support the Latin-9 (ISO-8859-15) character set. You cannot change the parent ID of a group. See Creating a Corporate Hierarchy for instructions on using this endpoint.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: apiTransKey
parameters.description: Web service password, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: "4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Galileo-issued provider identifier. Pattern: Max 10 digits Example: 9999

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred. Pattern: 60 characters or less Example: "9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Identifier of the group (group_id) as returned by the Create Group endpoint. Pattern: Max 10 numeric characters Example: "4522"

parameters.name: groupName
parameters.description: Name of the group. Pattern: 1â€“40 alphanumeric characters, including spaces, hyphens, and single quotes Example: "CDE Corp"

parameters.name: maxLevel
parameters.description: Maximum number of subgroup levels that can be created below this root group. Required when creating a root group. Not valid when parentGroupId is populated. This value cannot be changed to a smaller number after it is set. Pattern: Numerals 0â€“5 Example: 3

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: Provider-specified identifier for the group. Pattern: Max 30 alphanumeric characters Example: "L0000"

parameters.name: doingBusinessAs
parameters.description: Operating name of the company, if different from businessLegalName. Pattern: 2â€“150 alphanumeric characters, as shown in businessName parameter Example: "SportsBall Enterprises"

parameters.name: businessLegalName
parameters.description: Legal name of the business. Pattern: 2â€“150 alphanumeric characters, as shown in businessName parameter Example: "CDE Corporation, Inc."

parameters.name: phoneCountryCode
parameters.description: Country code prefix for phone. If this parameter is populated, then phone is required. Pattern: Plus sign (+) with 1â€“3 digits Example: "+011"

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Phone number for the primaryContactName. If this parameter is populated, then phoneCountryCode is required. Pattern: Phone number for the primaryContactName. Example: "18015551456"

parameters.name: primaryContactName
parameters.description: The name of the primary point of contact at businessLegalName. Pattern: 2â€“150 Latin-9 characters Example: "Maxina Seward"

parameters.name: primaryContactEmail
parameters.description: Email address of primaryContactName. Pattern: Email address, 3â€“63 characters Example: "mseward@cde-corp.com"

parameters.name: smartdata
parameters.description: Specifies whether the root group is to be enrolled in Mastercard Smart Data. Pattern: String Example: "Y"

parameters.name: employerId
parameters.description: The employer identification number (EIN) from the IRS. Pattern: 99-9999999. Example: "12-3456789"

Maximum level for a root group cannot be decreased. Set maxLevel to a value higher than the current level.

api_reference.title: Update Payment
api_reference.description: Use the Update Payment endpoint to update the number of hold days for a pending payment that was created with the Create Payment endpoint. You should not use this endpoint to update payments created with the Create Account Transfer or Create ACH Transaction endpoint. Consult the Creating a Payment guide for instructions on using this endpoint.

api_reference.title: Update Pending Merchant Credit
api_reference.description: Use the Update Pending Merchant Credit endpoint to post or post and hold a merchant credit if you are handling your own disputes. The threshold for manual review of merchant credits is set during product configuration using the ZREVW product parameter. To use this endpoint, first, use the Get Pending Merchant Credit endpoint to retrieve the settle_id value, then pass it in the settleId parameter. Use type to specify whether to post or post and hold. When the Galileo system receives the call to this endpoint, the credit is queued for processing.

parameters.name: apiLogin
parameters.description: Web service username, as provided by Galileo. Pattern: Max 50 characters Example: "AbC123-9999"

parameters.name: settleId
parameters.description: The settle_id as returned by Get Pending Merchant Credits. Pattern: /^[a-z A-Z]{1}-[0-9]{1,20}$/ Example: "v-43843747"

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of update to perform on the merchant credit: 1 â€” Post 2 â€” Post and hold Pattern: 1 or 2 Example: "2"

parameters.name: programId
parameters.description: Galileo-generated identifier for the program. Pattern: Positive integer Example: 1032

api_reference.title: Verify Account
api_reference.description: Use the Verify Account endpoint to return information on an account. For example, you can use this endpoint to validate that you can call Create Payment on the account without violating the load amount. Verify Account will also return secondary accounts that share the same balance ID and product ID. This endpoint returns: Current account balance â€” Both posted and authorized transactions are factored into the balance amount Current maximum amount that can be loaded into the account, according to product parameters External account ID Account PRN Galileo account number (balance ID)

api_reference.title: Void Create Account
api_reference.description: Use the Void Create Account endpoint to cancel an account (move the account into status: B, Voided account) that was created by Create Account. Pass either the transactionId of the original Create Account call or the optional accountNo parameter to identify and void the created account. The accountNo parameter can be the PRN that was returned by Create Account or a PAN that you can retrieve using Get Account Cards. ðŸ“˜NoteUse Void Create Account only for instant-issue (prepaid) card accounts. To reverse an account creation for other account types, use the CST.
